Review.text: wonderful hotel wonderful location The Hotel Francois 1er right off the Champs-Elysees is an excellent hotel in an excellent location. The service, rooms, and food are first class and the location couldn't be better! We had a wonderful week. The rooms are beautiful and the service was very efficient. We would definitely return to this this hotel.

Sweeping city views This is a great new hotel in San Francisco close to the Convention Centre and the main shopping area. I had the luxury of staying in one of the well appointed junior suites. These are located on the corners of the building so the room has huge floor to ceiling windows on two sides (also extending into the bathroom).The room was huge, complete with iPod docking station, huge flat screen TV and a massive bathroom with a walk-in double shower at one end. All the staff were courteous, especially the cheerful spa staff and my three night stay was very pleasant.

Location and Service Impeccable I stayed here for a convention that was held a few blocks away and was blown away at how incredibly perfect everything was. The price was super reasonable. The service was perfect. The accommodations and amenities left nothing more to be desired (except maybe an indoor pool but not a big deal in my opinion). Not to mention the location was in the dead heart of everything and walking distance to the convention center. I will stay nowhere else when staying downtown SF than the Palomar.

good choice Stayed here for one night while visiting family. The room was small but clean and comfortable with a good range of toiletries etc. Prior to our stay we had made some requests and the hotel had fulfilled these and we found the staff were all very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was also excellent, with plenty of choice and fresh foods used. I would certainly stay here again when next in London.

Marriotts have never disappointed me! I just got back, had great Marriott service as I always do and would stay at this one again in a heartbeat. Great fitness center, free internet at the business center, friendly, friendly, helpful staff, very clean room, 5 star service in a 3-4 star hotel. Its also a stone's throw from the Wharf and not noisy. Price was good considering the location (I paid about $200 a night). The staff was always, always, ready to help me out.

Fabulous We stayed at the fantastic Raddisson SAS Berlin over the New Year 04/05 and it's simply one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!!! As soon as you walk in, the aquarium just stuns you with its beauty and size! The staff are attentative and polite and the rooms are superb! The LCD tv's really make a difference and the room design and the 'wet room' style bathrooms are great. The spa is also one of the best! All in all, I have no hesitation in reccomending this wonderful hotel.

harming, romantic, quaint No complaints. Very, very pleasant accomodating staff. Room was lovely and quite large with a king bed and ultra comfortable mattress. Neither my husband or I felt unsafe in the area even after dark, but I can see if you're somewhat skittish you might be nervous since it isn't a high traffic area like it is right on Union Square. Great shower and vanity and loved the complimentary sodas in the fridge everyday. Will stay there again on our next visit.....

Stunning hotel and staff! Hotel is uber cool and beautifully decorated in a contemporary style.5 minutes walk from Sol square and tube and also the centre point of Spain!Bar is lovely for a drink and the restaurant looked equally nice but we did not eat there so cant comment on food. Rooms are a bit on the small side though!Staff are VERY attractive and also really nice and helpful. Would definately stay there again but am in no hurry to go back to Madrid.

Nice place to stay Loved the hotel, very roomy and spacious accomodations, nice cuisine, morning buffet a little pricey but overall it is totally worth plus location is just the best. It has an amazing restaurant nearby, seafood, and very famous.

clean and New Hotel This is a very new hotel, it is a non-smoking hotel, which was pleasant. The location is very close to the center, tram way is outside the hotel about 1 mins walk, and there is a bike hire place on the basement of the hotel which was very convenient as cycling is one of the easiest way to get around Amsterdam in the day or at night. The room is very big and the toilet is state of the art. Only complain is the free wifi is on the slow side of things. The buffet was really good, and the dinner at the restaurant is nice with very nice view of the river and the other side.
great Great staff, great beds, great everything! You can tell this hotel is new and well designed! Only thing i wasnt too happy about was the lack of a pool! Desk staff was awesome!

Frequent return business traveller Having to work away from home in the city is far from ideal and there are few quality hotels within the price range and vicinity of the Apex. The hotel is stylish and well appointed rooms with spacious beds, bathrooms, wide-screen TVs and DVD players make for a comfortable stay. The hotel has a good gym by comparison to other hotels in the area (i.e. More than the usual 3-4 machines).Room service is prompt and food standard is good. The staff are very attentive and professional. To be recommended for the business traveller or tourist.

Great Room and nice place to say We only got to stay one night here -- we were on a two week trip out West -- wished we could have stayed longer. The room was WONDERFUL. The hotel was clean, staff was helpful, it was in a great location, just beautiful. We walked to the Diamondbacks game. Great place to stay, would definitely recommend it. The Robey's - Welcome, Maryland

Great Resort Despite the coldest weekend in 16 years, we had a FABULOUS time at the JW Desert Ridge and barely realized that it was raining and even SNOWING in AZ! The JW did a wonderful job with service and addressing every need we had, and we were impressed from the valet attendant to the bellman to the room service! The grounds were beautiful and well maintained, and there were significant challenges given the temperature changes there. Truly a wonderful experience and would recommend this resort to anyone...that I like!

>Sent us to other hotel although room was paid already I reserved one room for my last night (21.01) in 10 days trip around Florida and for my surprise the staff told me they did not have rooms free although I had already reserved and paid the room through expedia 2 weeks before. The excuse was that some guests had spoiled some rooms, but I think they had overbooking and sent us to the Villa Capri (5 star officially, but really 3 star quality) that is just in front of Riu, but not right on the beach. They offered us free breakfast for 3 people next day and the right to use their pool, but I do not think they are serious people as they MUST respect paid reservations. On the other side the hotel seems nice and is well located close to the beach and Lincoln Rd.

Amazing Park Plaza Wallstreet Berlin it is a lovely hotel, very well located, although not a lively neighbourhood the most important sites (Alexanderplatz,Nikolai Viertel,Bradenburg Tor etc) are within 15-20min walk and the metro station is 1min from the hotel entrance ,there is also a nightbus coming from Alexanderplatz.the hotel is amazing, an old impressive building totally modernised in the inside, the staff is very helpful and kind, and the rooms are simply wonderful, with the high ceiling, the nice decoration and the most unbelievably comfortable bed i ever slept in in a hotel.well done park plaza

Great hotel, great location and good value We spent a lovely weekend at the hotel set in this quiet oasis in the middle of Madrid. Good value, nicely finished rooms and good quality public areas. Not only were the breakfasts good with lots of choice to suit all tastes, but we also would recommend that you do not miss the the afternoon tea in the bar - something we did not expect in down-town Madrid. All of the staff that we met were friendly and could not do enough to make our stay enjoyable.

Worthy of the Praise All we can do is echo the praise that other reviewers have bestowed upon this wonderful oasis. What an endearing spot! We felt welcome from the moment we arrived via the tiny elevator until the time of our all too soon departure. The other reviews accurately describe the warm and friendly atmosphere of this gem. We would stay at the Colomba again in a heartbeat and strongly encourage all to do the same.

>Never again! Two nights - never again! No aircondition, sloppy service, unsafe neigborhood, extrem noisy hallways (doors automatically slam shut), I could go on and on and on. Do NOT believe the flood of positive comments posted here (funny most of them showed up in the first week of August and are from CA, it seems to me the hotel employees had some spare time to post . .).There are dozens of better choices in SFO.

Nice Hotel My wife and I stayed here at the end of September and the beginning of October for 9 nights. This hotel is good value for money, we booked a partial sea view room which was clean and tidy. The location of the hotel is great just across the road from the beach with plenty of reastaurants and shops nearby. The only real downside to this hotel is that the swimming pool is small and does'nt see much of the sun.

great location, design hotel A lovely modern hotel in a great location, on a wide, very smart shopping boulevard in the centre. Also about 30 seconds from the (underground) train station to the airport (25 mins).Apart from the usual complaints about working the lights/blinds, and flooding the bathroom with the shower, we really enjoyed the room and our stay. Booked through the hotel website which gave us a free breakfast. We were at the back, and didn't hear any noise apart from a little from the corridor.

Brilliant hotel I spent two nights at Calzaiuoli at the end of last month and can't fault it. It's location is superb and although I was worried it would be noisy because it's so central, we weren't disturbed all night. The breakfast is exactly what you expect and perfectly good with lots of hot, strong coffee. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in Florence and this one is definitely up there with my favourite, the Antica Torre, but this one is definitely more affordable. The perfect base from which to explore Florence.

ver again at the dorsett seaview was the smallest room i have ever stayed .I wil never go there again ,it was like a coffin i felt sufforcated and the room was not clean we stayed only 1 night was booked for 4 but moved to the kowlon instead alot better

A nice one in Europe We had nice experience with this hotel. Location is convenient, though you still need to walk about 5 minutes from the main train station (not far, but it matters when you have luggages). Room is clean with comfortable bed, not big not reasonable and with AC!

What we expected The stay was pleasurable, we stayed in the ilikai tower on the thirteenth floor. We overlooked the hilton villiage and the beautiful pacific. The rooms werre stylish and the beds were very comfortable. It is walking distance to many attractions and a short driving disntance to the ala Mona shopping center. We enjoyed are stay and would defintely recommend this hotel.
Es gibt bessere f眉r das Geld! Blick auf'sESB vom Dach aus

Well kept secret The Coral Princess is a well kept secret that is tucked away among the larger hotels in the Condado area. I have stayed there four times, and each time has been great. The staff is great, rooms are a nice size, it's a great location, and it's clean, clean, clean. I'll definitely be staying here again the next time I am in Puerto Rico.

Amazing What an amazing place. We were down for our honeymoon and we could not have had a better time. We were apprehensive going down having read the negative reviews on this site. All I can say is that these people must be impossible to please. It was truly paradise.

A Great Base of Operations for Uptown Manhattan I was a bit concerned about staying at the Marquis right up until the moment we checked in. Our stay could not have been any better. Decent sized room for NYC, very quiet, great bed, helpful staff, excellent bars and restaurants, and the most efficient elevator system I have ever seen in a high rise hotel. Location was the most critical thing to me in picking out an NYC hotel and this one would be hard to beat.
Excellant Excellant value for money. 24hr buffet was a great. Hotel staff were welcoming and helpful. Room was very clean. Would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Marvellous Hotel Stayed at this excellent hotel for a short city break. Room was large, clean and comfortable with a fantastic view from the very large window (sixth floor). Staff were friendly and most helpful and the breakfast was truly great - kept us going for most of the day. Although the location was quiet, it was within easy walking distance of museums, Leidesplein, trams and canal bus stop. Would definitely stay ther again.

Our Favorite Small Hotel Clean, Comfortable, Caring, Generous. We had a truly fine stay at the Fita Hotel. .The de Rapper family really went well beyond the call of duty to help us have a great time. Little unusual extras, like free use of a computer, free local calls and beyond made us select this as a number one place to stay.

Highly recommend Coutyard Marriott downtwon San Francisco Excellent location, renovated rooms, clean, good value except parking at about $45 a day. But San Francisco parking is expensive everywhere. Car rentals are expensive, but airport taxi is even more. There are a number of restaurants in walking distance.

Excellent Hotel! Had a great stay! Love the white linens - very clean. Great looking and friendly staff - will be back!!!Phillipe, thanks for recommending Townhall. We have great pictures of us in the chair.

Excellent property this property is well above average. the staff are extremely helpfull. The location is very convenient. The restaurant is very good. The property is smaller than the other local major chains and affords more personal attention to your stay. Although the rooms are smaller, this property and its staff make up for the shortcome.

a walk to everything I read the reviews on this hotel after i had booked!!!! Then i started to worry about where l was staying, but it was all good,the rooms are tired and bathrooms need renovating but you are hardly ever in your room we had a partial ocean view on the 11th floor it was very relaxing good buffet breakfast included and so close to everything. I would deffinately stay there again, from what l hear most of the hotels need a good overhaul in Hawaii, dont worry about staying there you will have a great time.

Great place ! Me and my wife have just returned from the Sirenis Tropical ,This was our second stay at this resort and it was even better than our first trip two years ago. The food was excellent, it was very clean, entertainement was great, the staff was friendly,overall it was a fantastic stay. We will go back for sure !

Amazing hospitality! The young man who greeted us, Mozah, was very professional even though we arrived late. My wife was on crutches ( sprained knee just hrs before the flight) and even though we were there only for one night before our cruise and were given a room more accommodating for no extra charge! Very clean suite and would not hesitate to book for an extended stay as the location was close to everything! Two thumbs up for affordable accommodations. R. Chamberli

New York's finest hotel This is the best hotel in New York - over the years i have stayed in many for business and pleasure, but if you are spending your own money and want value and a lovely place to stay, this is the place. We had a park view room and waking up was a pleasure. indeed the curtains were never shut. What sets this hotel apart is the location and the extra amenities - the bar is one of the best in NY and the concierge can't help enough and it's all done unintrusively.

Nice hotel Just stayed one night - nice hotel, great location to the wharf. We did the dinner cruise on Spirit of Boston - just had to walk over and get on the boat. Would definitely stay here again. Comfortable bed too.

'Fantastic Hotel' Just returned fro a 3 night stay at the H10 Montcada hotel Barcelona with 7 Friends. Fantastic hotel, staff very helpfull and polite rooms spotless and central location superb, within walking distance of all attractions just a short walk down to the marina, the tour bus stops just up the street (鈧?20 / person all day unlimited travel). Travelled from the airport on the service bus ~ 鈧? per couple returned by Taxi ~ 鈧?25-30. Glass of carva on arrival and the breakfast was very good (if a little expensive). The bars and restaraunts around La Ramblas can be a little expensive but the is plenty of choice just off the main streets. Would certainly stay in this hotel again.

Great Location, Great Staff, Rooms a little Small (but hey, it's Paris) The location was great (facing the Pantheon, close to the Metro) and the staff was very friendly and helpful. We'll stay again nexy time we're in Paris. The only minor negative is that the rooms are awfully small (huge beds make it even worse). You can pay more and get larger rooms so that may be a good option. All in all we had a great stay and recommend this hotel to anyone.

Great stay and very convienent We got this hotel at a last minute bargain, and I am glad we did. The room, although small (but not smaller than normal European hotel rooms), was very comfortable. The king-size bed was fantastic and I always enjoy a place that gives you a robe with the towels. Very convienent, right next to Dam Square and walkable from the Train Station. I would definitely stay here again.

Excellent value I stayed in the hotel from 23-24 December. An excellent stay, nice spa, good food, very friendly staff and quite affordable. Check all the websites for offers, the prices I found varied 40 EUR per night. The hotel is in a quiet zone in the centre of Berlin, 15 min. walk to Potsdammer Platz with e.g. the Neue Nationalgalerie and a 15 min. walk to the Ged盲chtniskirche.

Enjoyable stay We have stayed at this hotel twice now. We have really enjoyed our stay. The beds are comfortable and we like the rooms. Both times I was attending a conference at University of Washington and it was an enjoyable walk to the campus. We really loved the wine tasting in the evening.
Great place! Nice Place. Service was great. Rooms were clean. I would stay here again.

As good as ever..the best! Interconnecting Garden Wing rooms were ideal for the family. As ever, we were looked after famously and everyone enjoyed eating out at The LIne. This remains the best Singapore city hotel in my view, since it has the most attentive staff and best quality food around. Another strong recommendation!

Hotel Allessandra was great We just returned from a 10 day stay in Italy with 3 wonderful evenings spend at the Hotel Alessandra. I highly recomend this quaint, perfectly located hotel. just 2 blocks from the Uffizzi and one block north of the Arno, the location is perfecto. More importanly, the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The service stands out as some of the best I have experience-the staff was very outgoing and knowledgeable with recommendations for meals. Be sure to chat with the delightful and engaging Monti-his Joie de vivre is infectious and he is loads of fun.

lov this hotel This was our second stay at the circle hotel. fabulous location. The rooms are clean, bathroom is a bit small but with so much to do in waikiki you really only sleep there. We will be back again next year.

Enjoyed the Orchard Experience Booked this Hotel after reading other reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disappointed. The Hotel is small but very reasonably priced for the area. The rooms are very comfortable and we had great nights sleep, didn't eat in hotel as was abit pricey for our liking, they did recommend very good eating places nearby that suited our requirements perfectly. Overall we were very pleased with this accommodation, and would choose to stay here again. The Cable Car is very handy but quite expensive to travel on single trips, so get a long term or multi trip ticket from the start.

AMAZING EXPERIENCE This is one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. A beautiful new hotel building, wonderful one bedroom suite, stunning views from our room and the VIP lounge, and excellent service. Combining our experience at the Four Seasons with visits to the other two highly recommended Hong Kong hotels - Peninsula InterContinental - left us with no doubt whatsoever that we made the right choice.

Wonderful stay We had a wonderful stay here for 3 nights. The room was nice, the beds are very comfortable and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. This is definately th茅 place to stay in Amsterdam for a short city break!

xcellent resort March 27, 2005We returned from Punta Cana yesterday and still are amazed at how wonderful the resort was. Especially the calm...quiet breeze, waves crashing on the shore, wide open beach, lots of empty lounge chairs waiting for us, and no vendors. The food was amazing, especially the breakfast buffet. There was so much choice and everything was beautifully prepared. The wine we were served is good quality. Champagne was available at all times!We would return, and recommend this place to everyone.
Ritz Carlton true 5 star Delivered true 5 star service in 5 star accomodation. Club lounge excellent. Staff knowledgeable and spoke excellent English. Great location. Couldn't have asked for better.

100% Happy. Was very sad to leave! Great views of the harbour/city, great service, great hotel, great room, great food, great bar, great facilities, great location, clean, comfortable, modern and the staff were always as helpful as they could be. It felt like a 5 star hotel but without a 5 star price. When I go back to HK assuming the prices are the same or similar I will definately stay there next time. Very very happy!

Fantastic pools, shame about teh beach replenishment Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in October 2008, and whilst the rooms were pretty bland the pools and outside areas facing the beach are lovely. 3 pools - one infinity, one with a pool bar and a spa pool. The hotel is right on the beach but the beach was being replenished during our stay so you couldn't actually use it and had to walk to the main Kuta beach (about 5 - 10 minutes). All, in all though this is a good holiday hotel and the staff were always very friendly.

Really average service Really ordinary service. Not able to place any call from the room (local-long distance), nobody could help up (in 2 different rooms). Breakfast is great. Rooms are big. Location is Okay in DC. Last year, stayed the Sheraton Four Points for 110 USD, was a better deal than Embassy Suites DC on 22nd.

Great hotel, ok location The rooms were lovely and the breakfast great. Convenient location for getting around Barcelona on foot. The 2 negatives were:1. being woken up in the early hours by the lorries delivering to the adjacent market2. being given incorrect information about finding the bus to the airport, which resulted in stress at the end of the vacationOtherwise, a good value hotel with lovely features.

harming small hotel Great location near the Duomo. Friendly staff. Delicious breakfast. Quirky comfortable rooms. I stayed at Il Guelfo Bianco in February and June this year -- both visits were very nice.

finest holiday money could buy This was my wifes first ever holiday outside the uk and we are happy we made the choice we did the hotel and facilities were out of this world the staff could not help enough. The food in all the restuarants was great and always clean and set out very nice our suite was cleaned every day and mini bar restocked any member of staff no matter what their position had time to stop and chat and always helpfull for our first time in the carribean it was some where we would return again definately to the bavaro princes

weekend at the westin this is a very nice hotel in a very good location in downtown dallas.the beds were soft.the shower was a heavenly shower with very good water pressure.the towels were very thick and soft.no pool.the only bad thing about this hotel is that it is connected to the plaza of the americas office complex which is closed on the weekends.so all of the shops are not open.there is an ice skating rink that is open for limited skating.pay the $20 for valet parking unless you plan to drive to other parts of dallas.the dart train is only about 2 blocks from the front door.

comfortable We just returned from a business trip to the hyatt this past weekend. Our room was very comfortable and very spacious. The food in the italian restaurant was very good as we went with the nightly special. The food at the revolving restaurant was excellent as was the service,although it was a little on the expensive side. The views are spectacular. The only thing that the hotel could improve on was seating in the main lobby--there is a couple of chairs and a couch and alot of empty space.

Great at the IC I was in New Orleans for business and truly enjoyed my sta at the IC. The location was the best and the service excellent. I usually have stayed at the Windsor Court, but for my money the IC is better.

Excellent Hotel in Florence Hotel Caravaggio - FlorenceMy wife and I stayed 4 nights in May'06, and would definitely return. Well represented by previous reviews. Ask staff about directions to Restaurant Academia, for well-priced and delicious Florentine cookingPros: * Location - 10min walk from main train station (Florence S.M.N.), 20min walk to Duomo, 30min walk to Uffizi, 35min walk to Pontevechhio, nice collection of bars and restaurants close by, 15min walk to supermarket, 10min walk to Internet Point * Facilities - rooms were clean and comfortable, free wi-fi access (bring your notebook to surf in your room), hotel bar open in the afternoon and evenings downstairs, nice breakfast in the mornings (breads, cereals, fruit, meats), mini-fridge in room, rooms have A/CCons: N

Excellent location and view! I was very pleasantly surprised by the hotel's location, new decorum view from our 21st level room and a complementary breakfast in the early morning before our tour. I haven't visited Waikiki Beach in decades and this overnight was a great way to end our week in Hawaii. Stacey and Agnes at the Expedia Desk were extremely helpful - booking a Pearl Harbor Tour and a last minute shuttle to the airport.

agree with previous re bedrooms I agree with the previous review- the bedrooms let the hotel down - there is obviously a variety of bedrooms. Our first bedroom was on the fourth floor at the back with a view of the inner courtyard - would have been fine if the room had not been so hot. Complained and told that this room did not have air-conditioning - moved to the room previously described with floor level windows and air-conditioning. Otherwise the hotel was excellent including the breakfast and location.
Enjoyed my stay Everything about my stay was great. The staff was helpful and their knowledge of San Francisco was excellent. I would highly recommend Hotel Rex and will stay there again myself.

Excellent hotel but can get expensive Hotel was clean and service was excellent. Restaurants in the motel are expensive so go out to eat. Hotel is classy with a beautiful lobby and front desk area. Beach area is shared with other hotels so it can crowded early. We do not recommend the dinner cruises, they are over rated and over priced, do a luai instead. Hotel is recommended and if you get room 1609 you will have a good ocean view without paying for it!

Great Experience My family had a lovely stay at this hotel. From the warm welcome from Pierpaolo to Paolo鈥檚 recommendations for family friendly sights to the cup of hot chocolate that was kept full for my son at breakfast鈥t was a great experience. Close to everything we wanted to do and close enough to the train station for my family to walk. Their graciousness helped make our family鈥檚 visit to Florence special.

Great place to stay What a brilliant stay!Excellent location within walking distance of many attractions. Staff friendly and helpful - service excellent. Room was contemporary, clean and of a high standard. Food was good as was the 'famous' Hilton breakfast. Would not hesitate to return here.

We just loved it We stayed there for our honey-moon and just loved it. The hotel is small but looked brand new to us. The staff were all so friendly and helpful and really did their very best to make our stay as comfortable as possible. We would definately go back and stay there.

Excellent I stayed here for 1 night on 20 Feb 07 whilst on business. Although outside is not particularly special my twin bedded room was excellent. Spotlessly clean and large, with seperate power shower, bath and loo with bidet. All staff were extremely welcoming and polite, especially the English 'bellboy' working 7-15h. I would stay there again whether for pleasure or on business. I agree with the reviewer who styed on 16 Feb 07.

Excellent I stayed there with a mate having arrived after 15hrs on planes from New York, Madrid and Barcelona. The staff were friendly and welcoming right from the start, with plenty of charm and good humour (which we found unusual in Spain on the whole)! Rooms were very clean and well maintained. It's in a great location for the night-life (ramblas) and was within easy walking distance of good bars, resturants, and other attractions. I'lld recomend this mainly for younger people, singles or couples as the nightlife in the immediate area is vibrant to say the least. Overall, a great hotel with excellant service, presentation and modern amenities, would stay there again without doubt.

Great location Stayed here for a weekend in mid-November. Hotel was fine - very good location, close to bars, restaurants, canal boat tours centraal station - it was clean and efficient and we had no complaints. We had read previous reviews and knew what to expect - despite the Crowne Plaza brand this is three star/travel inn standard (not the four star advertised) - so find a good deal only pay three star prices! Amsterdam is a great walking city - just watch out for bicycles!!!

Perfect Location... Fun Hotel Just returned from a two-night stay at the Triton, and I have to say my experience was in contrast to that of some of the other reviewers who felt there was a lack of restaurants in the neighborhood or that the staff wasn't helpful enough. We received excellent recommendations for dining in the neighborhood (Taylor St., Ryoko and Le Colonial) both nights of our stay from helpful concierge, Nick. Add to that a perfect location -- practically in Chinatown, right next to Union Square, and convenient to the waterfront--and a fun decor. It's true that some facilities could use better upkeep (e.g., plumbing), but for the price, I would go back to Triton again in a heartbeat.

Loved this hotel I stayed here recently with my 2 sons (ages 9 11). The hotel is perfectly located near the museums and leidisplein. The staff is awesome - extremely friendly and professional. The rooms were clean and our triple room was extremely large by European stds. I would recommend this hotel highly to anyone.

expensive for what it gives It's not really bad, but does not give value for money. When arriving at SFO airport, I called the shuttle line and was told that it would take about 10-12 minutes. I have seen all other hotel shuttles twice, before the Sheraton one arrived. The staff is friendly enough. I had diner there too, which was quite good, but the temperature in the restaurant was rediculously hot.

Benchmark in Hospitality My fiancee and I flew down to SF from Canada and were extremely impressed with the decorum and class of this hotel. From the elevator completely covered in pages from old books, the complimentary Aveda shampoo (my fiancee was particularly fond of this), timely valet service, and exemplary service, staying at Hotel Rex made our stay in SF a flawless experience. Based on price, hospitality, and location, I would highly recommend this hotel my closest friends and not hesitate to stay there again. Jim GintherSaskatoon, SK, Canada

wished I could have stayed longer What an awesome week! The food, fun, sand and sun were only the beginning. The incredible friendliness of the staff really made the trip. I would definitely return and play a whole lot more beach volleyball! I know the staff never loses but we can always keep trying!!! A vacation to remember!

good location - great hotel This is a wonderful hotel. Room was spacious and clean, staff were very helpful and friendly. The Cafe and Bar give the hotel a great atmosphere. The location is very good, plenty of good restaurants, tram stop and canal cruise close by.

Dull This hotel is standard business hotel. It's in a fairly dull location, the rooms are spacious and clean, but there is nothing to get excited about at all. The hotel staff when we stayed there were extremely helpful and friendly and added to the hotel, but as hotels go it's good value for money, but dull.

Wear Comfortable Shoes Had a great stay at this hotel - great service, comfortable bed, good location for all of our sightseeing needs. Wherever you stay in New York make sure you bring some comfortable shoes for walking. My feet were killing me after a day pounding the pavements. The concierge at this hotel was so kind to give me advice about finding comfortable shoes - he ponted me to a great website where I have since found comfortable walking shoes:[--]

Good hotel, problem with a burger I stayed here after a Red River Shootout, and it was good. The room was cozy and it was easy to access. My only problem is that they toast the buns to their burgers, and it's a little crunchy on the outer edge, which I don't like. Otherwise, it was a nice night for me.
Location... Location... Location. And price! showReview(2330047, 'full');

A hotel to return to in San Francisco, CA The location is perfect for the business man or the leisure traveler with walking distance to Union Square or a one block pickup on a historical trolley. The staff will remember you and the rooms make you feel right at home. You will return to this hotel.

Superb! My husband and I just spent four wonderful nights (and mornings and afternoons) at Matteo's beautiful new small elegant hotel on the Grand Canal. His great hospitality creates a house party atmosphere where guests are treated, and treat each other, like old friends. The wonderful terrace, for breakfast and evening spritzers and whatever else you'd like, provides the remarkable setting. Although near the Rialto bridge, serenity reigns. Al Ponte Antico is a magical place and we will return again and again.

Fantastic except for the rooms I am just coming back from the Sirenis and I have spent fantastic holidays. Everything is great :the pool ,the beach,the food, the cocktails but there is just a problem with the room with an awful smell and certainly not 5 stars but 3. Anyway a very good value for money. We were 7 people and we all enjoyed our holidays.

Wow!! Loved the Westin If you are staying in Beijing, the brand new Westin is the way to go. Very convenient to the metro and all of the attractions. Spa was awesome, as were the restaurants inside the hotel, which, by the way, were NOT overpriced!

it is what it is having seen some of these reviews i had to coment yes its not a five star hotel but then it dosnt claim to be and the pool will certainly leave you amazed (if not happy), but hey you pay a fraction what you would pay in the hilton village and you can easily walk there and spend all your day there on the best stretch of beach in waikiki all in all this hotel is what it says it is, a great base to explore waikiki from, clean friendy and reasonably priced

atedral lives up to its reputation! We have stayed at Hotel Catedral for the past 16 years whenever we go to Mexico City for business or pleasure. The staff knows us and we always get excellent service and treatment. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the restaurant is fantastic. It may not be a luxury property, but with the money we save we can eat at the most expensive restaurants around and thoroughly enjoy ourselves. I do not think I would stay anywhere else.

Great value for money Great value for money if you can get a discounted rate. Pretty good location. It's rated 3.5 (or 4 star) but it's more like a 3 star. Some signs of wear and tear but if you can get a good rate it has everything you need and you won't be like you overpaid.

A Good Stay We enjoyed our week's stay at the NH Doelen. It was a great location in the heart of Amsterdam and the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Breakfast was enjoyable and the rooms were small, but clean! I really enjoyed their line of bath products---good smelling body wash!

Luxury with a smile A touch of luxury but delivered with good humour and without the 'stuffiness' you might expect from such a renowned hotel group. Great location in one of the prettiest parts of Amsterdam, surrounded by excellent restaurants and bars. The room was spacious and beautifully furnished. Breakfast was a real event and all the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. We would have no hesitation in returning to the Pulitzer or in recommending this great Hotel to others.
Paging Det. Steve McGarrett. Paging Det. Steve McGarrett. Ain't Hawaii beautiful?

Great Atmosphere If you are looking for something at little out of the ordinary stay at the hotel Zaza. Everything about the place is unique. The quality of the service and back drops are not great, but if you can overlook the details it is worth the stay. We really loved the movies playing on the outside of the building when you arrive and depart in the evenings.

Bargain Stay Don't expect any frills but the service and location are excellent. One block off the heart of downtown Boston makes this hotel an excellent choice for location. A nice quiet spot with excellent service. The beds are a bit lumpy and the walls need some paint.

Great place to stay We have now stayed at the Nob Hill Motor Inn three times and have been there several nights each time we were in San Franscisco. We have never been disappointed. The people who run this inn are very helpful, friendly, and resourceful. Our room has always been very clean, quiet, and comfortable. It is located conveniently close to public transportation and we have always been given good directions at the front desk. We definitely will go back the next time we visit the area.

Very good choice Excellent location : close to every touristic spot and surrounded by restaurants and bars. Of course a bit noisy at night as this is the busy area to go out. Rooms are clean and decoration is great. Staff was very helpful. Very good choice for Madrid.

Great value Great location and value of money. Rooms are small but clean. Staff is friendly and helpfull. The only thing - sometimes you can hear your neighbour walking in the room. But anyway I would stay here again.

Absolutely beautiful and chic hotel I stayed here in Feb of this year with two friends of mine, a girly trip! And i was very impressed by my stay. The hotel was so gorgeous and modern. They serve the best caesar salad! Also I left a pair of new jeans in the wardrobe and when I contacted them on my return to Dublin they posted them to me free of charge, nice touch! Would definitely go back there.

Perfect We have just returned from 6 nights at the Apsis Atrium Palace. Perfect Location, Perfect Hotel, beautifull rooms, we stayed at the front hotel rooms, no noise from the gran via street. Very good breakfast for the value- book in advance from the hotel website so it is only half price -8 euros. The staff is very nice and the free 4 bottles of water per day are a bonus very wellcome - barcelona is hot.

I liked the Mosser The Mosser is a very clean, comfortable, friendly, attractive hotel that's in a great location in San Francisco. It's also inexpensive. The only drawbacks - which are no secret - are that the rooms are small (although very well arranged) and the bathrooms are shared (or at least mine was). If you're OK with that, definitely stay at the Mosser.

Great Location The Borgmann Villa backs on to Amsterdams beautiful Vondel Park and a room with a view is great, Its a 10 min walk to the Museum's and Leidseplein, the tram is 3 min's away, breakfast at Cafe Vertigo in Voldel park is worth the trouble. Some single rooms are small but I only slept there so it was fine I thought it was good value and the location was great the staff very very helpful (they even loaned me a bike) and its quiet after a busy day. I will stay there again.

Lovely Quiet Quality Hotel I have had the pleasure to stay at this hotel twice in the past few months and was very impressed with it. The staff are very friendly, the hotel is very clean and quiet and so close to all in the city. The location being next to Central Railway Station is an asset and make it very easy to get to all locations whilst on holidays. The renovations to this hotel have made it nice and fresh with quality fittings and a pleasure to spend time in.

Great business trip Last week, I stayed in the Hotel Le Cirque in New Orleans because I had an event over there. It surprised me with the great service and kindness of the staff. There is one guy who helped us, Mike, he is very nice. They tell you how to get to places, and also the hotel is so clean, which is what I look for in a hotel. I definetely recommend it.
Fantastic! For an airport hotel - the Sheraton is great! Nice rooms and amenities. A bit pricey; but worth it for being able to chek out and literally walk into the terminal!

Great Place I stayed there recently and was very pleased. The lobby and rooms were very well done. There were free appetizers in the evening including chocolate covered strawberries that were amazing. The place is located one block off the beach which made it very convenient. I would definitely stay here again.

The Wonderful Watertown This was a wonderful experience. The staff couldn't be more helpful, the only problem is that they are going to burn themselves out if they keep going at this rate. We stayed first of all in the Boardroom Suite then in the View Suite - with great views. Well worth just walking up to 'The Ave' just a few blocks away, to visit the 'quirky' shops in the University district.

OK, but The hotel is located ideally for tourism. If they offer you a room around by the pool, DO NOT TAKE IT!! These rooms are not refurbished, noisy surroundings (generartors etc). The staff are very false, behind their smile is a very miserable person. The rooms in the main building are to standard, not the biggest but goog enough.

Not the worst hotel ever... ... but nothing special. The hotel is very dated and dingy, with a funky smell throughout. Room was tolerable but not the cleanest. Way overpriced for what it was. If you just need a place to sleep and don't plan to spend any time in the room, it might be fine, otherwise, I'd look elsewhere.

Avoid at all costs How this place can call itself a 4.5/5 star hotel is beyond me - obviously the management have no grasp of hospitality unless they previosuly ran a prison or similar. Room wasn't clean, service non existent bordering on don't care attitudes, I can honestly say that I have had better experiences in BBs. Dreadful, simply dreadful. Avoid - I'd suggest a tent if this was the only place left to stay in NSW!

Amazing views and Jazz Club We spent 3 nights in the above. Our room was very large with a bedroom and lounge. It would of slept 4 people .The views over the River Charles were wonderful .The staff first rate and helpful for such a large hotel. Scullers jazz club was located in the hotel and is a great place to hear live jazz at a reasonable pric

Location, location, location This is just a very quick review - I take from this site so think if is only fair to give back something, even if it is only very brief. On the basis of the reviews on this site we booked the Alicia and were not disappointed in the least. I'm a fussy devil, and where possible do like to stay in 4* hotels, but I could not find fault with this hotel other than there was no tea-making facilities in the room. I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to anyone.

Loved it! My husband whisked me away to New York City for my Christmas present, needless to say I was blown away by the city and the hotel. The view from our room was great, the floor to ceiling windows and flat screen TV were nice touches and the bed was possibly the most comfortable either of us have slept in. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful and the lift was super quick! Would recommend this hotel.

Just OK Conveniently located in Waikiki. Can be very noisy at night! A bit outdated too. Overall, nothing special for what you pay. I guess I would try another hotel if I had to get back to Waikiki (which I guess is unlikely :-).

Hoped for more I went on Orbitz.com to book the hotel and was quite excited after reading the reviews and seeing pictures of the hotel. Arrival and check in was a breeze but the room was not what I expected. The bed was terribly uncomfortable, the room was small, and the view was terrible. It's very close to the action, but next time I will spend a couple extra bucks to stay somewhere I know I will enjoy.

Top Notch Service I stayed at the Windsor Court for three nights while in NOLA for work. I was sick one day, and the kitchen staff went the extra mile to make sure I had fresh chicken soup and asprin. Every single employee seemed to go above beyond. I especially enjoyed the friendly staff at the Polo Lounge.

Wonderful Hotel Unbelievable service from the moment you walk in the door. Not enough superlatives to describe the efficiency and friendliness, even down to the maids. Great location in Potzdammer Platz and lots of nearby restaurants and entertainment. The room was wonderful from the bed to the incredible shower/bath. Worth the price.

Beautiful hotel I thought this hotel was very beautiful. The rooms were great as well. The beds had nice duvet covers and were comfortable. The hotel is located close to the French Quarter so it is easy to get around. I highly recommend.

Wonderful hotel This is a wonderful hotel, probably the best we've ever stayed in, lovely spacious room and bathroom, and the friendliest and most helpful staff, with no exceptions. Its location is excellent too. Well worth paying extra for access to the executive lounge. Even the heavy rain couldn't dampen our enjoyment as the hotel provided huge umbrellas free of charge for the duration of our stay. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will definitely stay there again!

Tradeoffs This location has huge tradeoffs. The good news is that this is a convenient tourist area with amusing sights such as street performers. The bad news is that the area also attracts activity such as pickpockets and other mischief. Factor that risk into your decision whether to stay near Las Ramblas.

THIS IS THE RITZ CARLTON? 3 DAYS/ 4 NITES, July 1-4, 2005. ran out of towels at pool side,not enough waiters at poolside,rib eye steak for dinner poor,waited 45 min. for a sandwich, lunch time,room wasn't ready when we arrived, very disappointed!

Nice We stayed here for 3 nights over new year's and couldn't really fault it. The concept, the design and the comfort levels are all worthy of praise, as are the staff, one of whom on seeing us getting out of a taxi in a downpour, met us at the door with a couple of towels. Nice touch. Thanks Sonja.

Excellent Hotel Great hotel. The location is excellent close to Union Square. The staff were friendly and helpful. Rooms were very nice with comfy beds and very clean. We enjoyed a very nice dinner at the hotel restaurant as well. I would absolutely stay there again.

Lovely My friends and I stayed here for four nights over the St Patricks day period. Our rooms were on the 36th floor, really nice rooms, very clean and modern, maid service every day. The only thing I would fault would be, some of the reception staff are quite rude, and keep an eye on your bill with the bar staff, if they are serving at your table, keep tabs of what you had as they do seem to try to add drinks on that you haven't had, or imply you haven't paid! This also happened to another couple who were staying there the same time as us!Apart from that, good location and a lovely hotel, would stay here again.

great hotel Just returned from a wonderful 4 day trip to Paris. Our hotel Relais Bosquet was great. Room was lovely and clean, with a wonderful view of the Eiffel tower. Both Gerard and Frederika were most helpful with any questions we had. very well appointed rooms with everything you need, quiet and peaceful, 2 minutes to Metro station and of course Rue Cler. We will go back for sure.

Okay for the money... Stayed at the Hotel Accademia for 3 nights in mid November 2004. The room was decent, clean and relatively quiet. The bathroom was huge by Italy standards and very updated. The location was great, would stay here again.

Loved this hotel Loved this hotel. Great locations, friendly staff, great price. Would definitely stay there again. Do wish they had coffeepots in room but did have coffee in the lobby. Clean, decorated so cute, comfortable beds. Location was perfec

Great central hotel We have just returned from a weekend in Amsterdam staying at the Hotel Eden. After reading previous reviews on Trip Advisor we didnt know what to expect but the Hotel couldnt have been better. We stayed on the 5th floor in a lovely clean room with the most comfortable bed and pillows ever! The staff were friendly helpful and the hotel is in a great location. Would definitely stay agai

mfortable, Clean, Stayed at the Ohana West from 1/22-1/29/05, was pleasantly surprised after reading many mixed reviews. We had a city/mountain view, king room, on the 16th floor with a nice size lanai, the room was a little small, but clean and comfortable. The daily housekeeping service was very prompt and did a very good job, and all the staff at the hotel demonstrated excellent customer service. The location of this hotel is perfect, it is centrally located to all the great things to do in Oahu. If your looking for a 5 star hotel this is not the place, but if your looking for a nice place with reasonable rates and great service, then this is the place to stay.

Excellent hospitality Our large group discovered the Europa via Trip Advisor, and all the previous positive reviews are spot on. The Europa doesn't seem to appear in any guidebooks, and the entrance lobby downstairs is unpromising, but once you arrive in the hotel, Gassim and his daughter Miriam are wonderfully discreetly attentive hosts. The rooms at the back are quiet and elegantly furnished, and the hotel is perfectly placed - a couple of minutes' walk from the Duomo. Our group of 13 stayed for a week, and felt we really had found a home from home.

Great hotel I've stayed here 3 times and every time it was great. The room was spacious and the hotel is across the road from the train station. If you're travelling by train, this is definitely the hotel for you. There are also international calling booths across the road at the train station and a post office to send souveniers to your family and friends, just across the road. Breakfast was great and there is free internet.

Beautiful Hotel in the Middle of Tokyo After staying in the Akasaka Excel Hotel, we moved to the Prince because it was cheaper and are we glad we did! The Prince is a beautiful hotel with big, modern rooms (some with a panaoramic view of Tokyo). The service was also excellent and the price was excellent. We never ate there as there are many local dining options just down the street. Highly recommended.

Good clean hotel we stayed at the Hotel Caravaggio for 2 nights. Its within walking distance of the train station and major sights. Breakfast was good. The room was clean and the staff were helpful and overall an enjoyable stay.
Pretty Good... The hotel is clean and well located. The people who work there super friendly. Rooms and bathrooms are good size and air conditioned. No iron/ironing board in the room!
Rooms need some love! an ok hotel but the rooms are suffering. Could do with a renovation. In a very good location with excellent staff. The hotel pool while small, is actually quite nic

The staff are special here This is a budget hotel in a good location central to everything. The nearest underground is City Hall and compared to the opposition is extremely good value for Manhattan. There are plenty of good restuarants within walking distance. The staff are really nice people and I would recommend it for people visiting New York without hesitation.

Super Stayed for three nights on business. It is just super. Great room. Great view and good location. I would definately stay here again if I had to return to Singapore on business. Only complaint was the breakfast buffet was really crowded, noisy and not at all tranquil.

Great break Arrived on the Saturday afternoon, pleasant staff greeted us. We were shown to our room via going through the famous garage area. We stayed on the fifth floor, i can honestly say that our room was very clean had working aircon and a safety deposit box. I do not have one complaint to make about the hotel, considering it only cost me 拢112.00 for three nights stay with breakfast i think that i came out of it very well.

Unbelievably friendly staff - highly recommend Excellent hotel - service beyond our wildest dreams. Osam and his staff was really friendly, helpful and accommodating. They treated our children like royalty for our short stay, and we really appreciate that. The steps up to reception look daunting, but it adds to the authenticity of the building in my view. The only downside was the weather, and I can't blame the hotel for that!!!

Pleasantly surprised Very close to airport, staff kindly checked me in very early and after I freshened up pointed me in the right direction to the main centre. There is a 4 storey outlet mall attached and MTR right next door. 20minutes and in Kowloon. Room was unexpectedly ample, well fitted out and great value. Andrew Smith, Auckland

venient, helpful I stayed here as a single female and it was a great place to be. The concierge was able to recommend great restaurants and trips, and the hotel is right next to lots of the sights, and the cable car turnaround so it's easy to get anywhere. Downside - I would have preferred facilities other than the adjoining seafood restaurant for breakfast etc. Definitely recommend.

I loved this hotel I have stayed in Le Meridien chain a lot and have never been disappointed. This one was no exception. It has beautiful rooms, marshmallow-like comfortable beds and marble bathrooms. The staff were also very professional, courteous and friendly. It is conveniently located near the Embarcadero Center, but not very well-known to taxi drivers.
Als Zwischenstopp f眉r Weiterfl眉ge eine ausgezeichnete Wahl showReview(11358887, 'full');
Fantastic! This hotel was wonderful. Extremely comfortable beds, very clean with a very helpful, friendly staff. We would definitely return.

Beautiful accomodations We stayed at The Legacy in September 2006 and found the accomodations to be very clean and beautifully decorated. There were two TV sets with DVD players, a kitchen, jacuzzi tub, dining room area, etc. The workout room was very well-equipped with up to date machines and TVs. Would definitely return!!!

Excellent Expereince - Great Service The hotel was amazing. The Decor was really modern and nice, The hotel was clean and beds were confortable. The staff very helpful, they directed us on how to save hundreds on show tickets, where most hotels would only offer you there services, stadd multiple times showed us the best options which were outside the hotels services. We had a end corner room which had an elevator next to it, felt like we had our own private elevator (only once in 4 day was another person in it).

Excellent stay at Casablanca Casablanca is the perfect location for those who wish a central location and like to walk to get around. Everything was closeby including an off Broadway play. Restaurants in the immediate area were great. The staff at Rick's Cafe and at the front desk were very helpful and extremely enjoyable to spend a few minutes chatting with. We requested a quiet room and enjoyed a restful sleep every night which we thought amazing because of the close proximity to Time Square.

School Group I brought a group of middle school students to stay here on June 3-6, 2004. The stay was fantastic. I really appreciated that there was hotel staff located on ground and then again in the hotel lobby checking to be sure that only registered guests were entering the hotel. The front desk staff, housekeepers, concierge, security, and porters were all very nice to the kids. The price of the hotel is on the moderate to high side but the location (1/2 block to the Times Square subway station), experience, and high quality made it worth it.

Loved the building stayed for one night in july. Excellent location close to airport, walking distance to Van Gogh Museum and lots of nice restaurants and Terraces around the hotel. Staff is the most helpfull I have seen. Internet connection in the room is expensive, but there is a PC with internet connection near the reception that can be used for free. Hotel bar is nice, and I got the most delicious apple pie in my life in this hotel... strogly recommend it.

ustomer Service is amazing! When it comes right down to it, the Renew is a great place to stay because of the attitude of the staff who take customer service very seriously and did everything that they could to make my one week stay comfortable. The Renew still needs to renew their air conditioner units which are aging and a little week. On the whole, a great place to stay. Such a nice alternative to places like the Hilton.

Excellence is Excellent!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This resort was sooooo..... romantic and peaceful. The entertainment staff: Rey, Frankin, Mariel, and Rosemary made every day a whole lot of fun . The food was excellent, the excursions was good. I definitely recommend this resort to any one looking for a romantic getaway.

Good deal I stayed at this hotel with my husband as part of a Bristish Airways package. We had no problems with service. The accomodations were sufficient. It was in in a great location as far as access to Madrid. Would definately stay there again.

Great location - good value The location is fabulous, the rooms are clean and nicely decorated, we felt we really got our money's worth at this hotel. There is an excellent restaurant right around trhe corner (the Golden View) that sits out over the Arno river. We did not have any of the problems listed here in other reviews - no bugs, extremely courteous staff, no foul odors, nice clean rooms with excellent air conditioning. We'd stay again without any reservations.

Room with a view Lovely reception staff and lovely room we stayed in with a view of a Duomo (not the main one). Very new bathroom. Lift access, 24 hour reception. The breakfast was amazing (included) - range of cheeses, bread, meats, and sweet pastries plus the much-needed expressos!Bar and lounge area. Ideal for walking around Florence - literally down the road from the Duomo.
des odeure d'茅gout et une eau jaun芒tre....... showReview(15571039, 'full');

Lovely Hotel Excellent stay, hotel is in a great location and the rooms are good, well sized, bathroom was good size. Very clean well kept. The beds are the most comfortable ever, like a massive marshmallow! The breakfast is brilliant, with loads of choice, restaurant, amenities, staff all brilliant. Would recommend. Only downside I can think of is that as stated by others reviews, they do not provide much in the tea/coffee making kit, but the card said that you could have more if

Great stay I stayed here for a week in June, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. For an airport hotel, it was surprisingly quiet, rooms were extremely comfortable and well prepared, and the staff were all extremely helpful and courteous. The only drawback was that the restaurant was a little on the pricey side for breakfast, but there are many places nearby to eat. A great hotel that I would happily stay again in.

ute Place Stayed at the Avenue Gardens hotels during Jazzfest. Great sized room, very nice atmosphere. Front Desk was helpful and polite. The hotel was in a good area with nice restaurants within walking distance and the trolley right across the street. Would definitly stay here again.

Brilliant location Simple, clean, efficiant hotel in an ideal location for restaurants and attractions. Metro nearby too. Stayed there with family and also for a rugby weekend. One word of warning..... don't go to Aarapana Indian Restaurant nearby. It was dreadful!

Good Hotel, Good location Hotel Aalders was the best choice we could have made. Good location, nice hotel with extreme friendly staff. The staff was a big help to reserve several tours for us as explaining where to go in Amsterdam without feeling a tourist!!!!Our room was clean and comfortable with television, telephone and in the bathroom bath, toilet, sink, hair and shower gel and a hairdryer!!!At the hotel bar you could use the internet service at any time. Breakfast was good with different choices and we could come in to the hotel at anytime of the day or night because of the day and night receptionists. We were very happy to stay at the Aalders Hotel and will return for sure to this hotel when we are back in Amsterdam.

Great location and spacious room Can't argue with the location (short walk to Universal Studios, short drive to Hollywood and downtown), or the room which was massive and comfortable with a great bathroom. Price for room was pretty good and they were able to extend our stay by a day (you will need time to explore LA). Only downside were the exorbitant charges for even short local phone calls and internet access. Everyone knows hotels love to charge for any extras, but their prices were outragous and we simply couldn't avoid them due to crcumstances. Breakfast was nice and reasonably priced (extra to cost of room) Overall, pretty good, just a shame they feel they have to rip off tourists who need to make urgent calls.

blissful retreat It was a while ago, but we adored Uma Sapna. Having our own pool was fabulous. On the downside it IS quite a long walk from the beach/restaurants etc, especially in the dusty heat. Fabulous restaurants in the vicinity. Great value for money (which is slightly unusual in Bali).

Golf Ball Soap... This is a great hotel for the price. It has a free mini bar with coke and beer. The decor is modern and the rooms are always clean.the pool is tiny, but i didn't care. i wasn't in town to hang out at the hotel pool.they only thing that gets me, is that stupid little golf ball soap, i just don't get it.

Totally ok I spent there 3 nights in the begining of May, nice hotel, just few block uphill to famous Lombard street, the same walking distance to Fisherman Wharf rooms were cleaned, front staff very polite and helpful. Free access to computer in a lobby. Breakfast maybe not interesting (just donats and crossaints), but wake up coffee is there, and free covered parking can allowed to forget about breakfast. I'd come back again, good spot.

reviews are spot on excellent location - restauarants and bars are all on the street right in front of the hotel.sites very easily accesible with both the u bahn and s bahn right outside the door.we didnt have breakfast - its 15 euros but if book day before its 11. To be honest though, once you have found a place to eat, ordered juice, coffee and say crambled eggs you have pretty much spent that anyway so it is probably worth it as its a buffet.bar in hotel nice to start in or have a drink before bed.if you stay in the front of the hotel - the windows are transparent!we stayed with two children and hotel was fi

Great Location Great location just outside the Red Light District. Staff are friendly and helpful. Onsite pub has great prices and the free hot breakfast buffet is excellent. Rooms are clean but small and include all amenities. The hotel is also very close to the train station and all Amsterdam attractions.

Great Place to Vacation! I thought it was very nice there where only 3 things i would watch out for : People with a royal shirt they try to sell you stuff, the vendors they chase after you so you will buy there stuff and the costant music playing but other than that it was great the beach is lovely the pool is a perfect temperature and the swim up bar is great! I would definitely go back.

Great small hotel in the old town There can't be many hotels on earth owned by such a fascinating man as this one. The rooms are all equipped not only with everything you need for a very comfortable (and affordable) stay, but also with copies of the owner's writings - thoughts, reflections and words of wisdom, a kind of cross between Khalil Gibran and Marcus Aurelius. He himself is an inspired and inspiring presence, and a stay in his wonderful, charmed hotel is capable of changing the course of a person's life. There are testimonies on the internet to this effect. It seems he will drop everything for a deep conversation with a guest. The hotel also has a wonderful rooftop bar and restaurant, which is great place to catch the evening light and eat excellent local gourmet food.

wonderful people beautiful beach We had heard so many mixed things about the DR. Some good and some bad. Well I can say this about the Grand Bahia Pricipe we had an amazing time. The weather was great, the people were friendly and what an amaizing beach. We are going back in April to get married.

Highly Recommend Victoria 4 Victoria 4 is well located, near Plaza de Sol, about half-way between the Prado and the Royal Palace, and a short walk to the Gran Via. There are many restaurants in the immediate neighborhood. The hotel staff was helpful, the room sufficiently large, clean and quiet. The lobby is somewhat small. The breakfast, which was included, was more than satisfactory for a continental breakfast. Victoria 4 is a good choic

Great hotel, great service I was impressed by all aspects of the Affinia 50. Sophistication without the attitude, which is so hard to find. When I was concerned about how to find a particular restaurant by cab, the person at the front desk found the restaurant in the NYC Zagat guide and made a copy of the listing for me. The service from the bell staff was equally terrific. I can't wait to return!

New Cliff Vilas best in Bali We spent seven nights there over Easter and stayed in the new Cliff Vilas. For under $US600 a night incl breakfast, it was extraordinary value for money. The vilas are the size of a house, with a large and magnificent private pool, cabana, grounds, living room and bathroom that is equal in size to half the vila. You see the ocean from every room, the butler was great and whilst the staff were not the most efficent in the world, their efforts and kindness make up for it. 10 out of 10.

A Great Time My wife and I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Sheraton Airport in Amsterdam. We found it very comfortable and accessable to locale transportation. I would also like to mention how the staff was very friendly and helpful i.e. Frank in the restaurant and Daniel as bell staff.

Best hotel in TIMES SQUARE This is a fantastic place to stay in NYC. You can get it for pretty low prices on priceline if you can wait until last minute, but as far as TIMES SQUARE hotels, its the best of over 10 we've stayed at. Great location, great security, great FRIENDLY service from everyone! Justly lovely.

Great value for the money This hotel was perfect for our stay in Hong Kong. It was directly across the street from a MTR stop making transit around the city a breeze. The rooms were very clean and very modern. The staff was very professional. I have absolutely no complaints and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Hong Kong in the near future.

Loved Emporio Reforma We loved Hotel Emporio Reforma it was very clean, safe and the staff was very helpful and friendly. The food served on the breakfast buffet was fresh and delicious and affordably priced. The taxi service available through the hotel was very friendly and helpful. This centrally located Hotel was the nicest hotel in this price range I have ever stayed in, for such a big city I think it was a wonderful surprise to have a place so affordable be so nice.

Great location - shame about the noise We stayed at the hotel for 2 nights. The location was excellent. The furnishings in the room were a bit dark and dreary. The first night was quiet but the room next door was occupied the second night, and we could hear every noise. We couldn't go to sleep until they switched their TV off. On the plus side, the staff were very friendly and helpful.

Great hotel, excellent location We (a group of 10) stayed at the H10 Marina in June 2008 on a hen weekend, and I would highly reccomend this hotel. It is clean, well kept with minimalist modern decor and the staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The location is also great, about 10 minutes walk from the bars at Port Olympic. The pool area is quite small, so if that is a priority for you it may not be ideal, but as we didn't have time for sunbathing that was no issue.

OK Location but noisy rooms Hotel Balmes looks very plush from outside and in the reception area, however we were in room 13 and it was very dark and also very noisy, didn't get too much sleep during our stay. Our room was spacious though and had a seating area as well as sleeping area and nice bathroom. The walk to Placa Catalunya was about 20 minutes I would say, which was further than I had originally thought, but it was easy to find our way around. Didn't have breakfasts at the hotel. Used the garden area, but not the pool although it did look very tempting, but the weather wasn't really warm enough.

Up to our expectations An excellent stay at the Elysee. We had a wonderful large room on 14th Floor which had a balcony and view which was just what we asked for. The breakfast and afternoon cheese and wine were really enjoyed. The hotel is ideally situated close to main attractions and Central Park and just across the road from Metro but in a very quiet road. Would definitely stay here again.

Great Vacation!! My friends and I spent a week at the Marriott in San Juan and we loved it!! We enjoyed the beach and the hotel itself and had tons of fun! It was near everthing and the best part was it was between Old San Juan and Isla Verde (which are two great places to visit). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Very nice hotel in great location I have just come back from a long weekend in Paris where I stayed in the Agora. It was a wonderful little hotel, the staff were all very polite and could not have been more helpful. The location was superb with lots of local caf茅s and restaurants. It is also only a five minute walk to Notre Dam and only 2 minutes to a metro station. I will definitely be staying here again in the future.

>ok but smelly Room was large and comfortable but smelt A LOT of cigarettes. They don't have non-smoking rooms. Breakfast wasn't inclued in the price but the bakery across the road sold some excellent food options (opens at 7am).

Great location for 02 arena Great location with train station next door. Check in was pleasant staff really nice making us feel really welcome. Room was lovely, clean, fresh and well presented. Didnt have andy drinks for food at the hotel as we were going to the 02 arena. Check out was quick also and staff again really warm again.

Great place to stay This is a great hotel to stay in. The hotel staff were very friendly and polite and always helpful. The breakfast buffet served almost everything you could want. The hotel is centrally located, taking only 2 minutes to walk to the KaDeWe (and the Kurfustendamn) and 5 minutes to the zoo. Would recommend this hotel to anyone and would definately book it again when returning to Berlin.
Perfect We spent a weekend here and it really was as close to perfect as any stay can be. Great location, great room, great lounge, fantastic breakfast. In this hotel hospitality is a way of life.

Good hotel, good location Stayed here for 3 nights in July 2004. Found it as you would expect for a large chain hotel. Large, smart lobby, check in staff advised us on safe areas to walk at night on arrival. However they were unable to locate the safe we apparantly had in our room! Friendly attendant in the swimming pool/gym, although lots of kids in the pool. Room fine - clean fair size.

very comfortable and elegant very comfortable and elegant room. The hotel is in a nice location in Barcelona, near the center. Very tasty the breakfast buffet. Very kind the staff of the hotel. A fine, relaxing experience.

harming personal service at Hotel Casci The rooms were clean, comfortable and lovely to look at. Breakfast was wonderful. And most of all the staff was thoroughly accomodating and helpful. Three thumbs up!

It's All True! We stayed here just one night during a week-long stay in the Chianti area, and the member raves are quite well deserved. The hotel is extremely well situated; the owners/staff could not have been nicer or more patient and accommodating; the rooms were immaculate, and ours was of quite decent size. We didn't take the breakfast, but heard from our friends that it was lovely. We would absolutely recommend Hotel Casci to all of our family and friends traveling to Florence, and we hope to come back soon ourselves.

Beware of leaving cash in the gift shop for postage. Very pleasant experience with one exception. The gift shop stated they out of postage and if I would leave cash, the stamps would be purchased at the post office and my post cards would be mailed for me. I had a number of cards and left the saleslady approximately equivalent of $14+ US dollars for the postage. While cards mailed from other locations across China, arrived at their destinations, not one of the cards left in the hotel gift shop were ever received.

Preferred Business Address Nice amenities, but since I came here on business, I needed an internet connection in my room. That service was sorely lacking. Not only that, the connections only worked in the lobby where people had to jockey for position to use them. This may sound insignificant, but for a hotel that bills itself as a preferred business address and has no internet and no business center, this hotel gets a big fat zero. Not only that, but the management seemed to not care less when i voiced my concerns. at the very least, i should've been comped for my use of the cyber cafe a few blocks away

Pretty Good not much activity inside the hotel except for salsa bandsthe hotel is 12 mins away from the major malls and old san juan. the bell boys were terrific, staff polite and friendlybuffet breakfast was good - pools were nice, gym was basic internet was fast enough clean spaious rooms.i just wish the rates were cheaper.there is only one restaurant in the hotel and its not the greatest but its OK

New safe Quality Hotel in HK for me Changed hotel in HongKong after having read comments from other Tripadvisor visitors. No regret at all contrarely the best price /quality /service i had since i travel to HK (12 years for business).Make sure you upgrade for the Executive club lounge saving early evening drinks and starters for dinner(if you want) but this than much more relaxed and of high value and quality. Used the Boardroom for a two day meeting,just and just more than what you need,all perfectly well organized and controlled. Langham Place is my new business hotel from now onwards in Hongkong .Did not had the time to explore suroundings but the better i can conclude on the hotel and his facilities.

Great if it weren't for the desk staff Beds, location and cleanliness were excellent. HOWEVER, the front desk screwed up a simple Kinkos delivery for me, and my traveling companion's reservation- then tried assigning blame on him despite his ability to produce confirmation numbers and dates. All ended well, but customer service was AMAZINGLY bad. Probably fine for tourist travel, but be warned that for business travel this is the worst Starwood property we've ever stayed in.

harming, quaint hotel in central SF location If you're looking to stay at a very charming, quaint hotel, then try Laurel Inn. The lobby and sitting area are comfortable, and the rooms are simply furnished and looked retro. There was nothing pretentious about the staff or the services. They were very helpful in directing us around the city to restaurants. It was a no-frills boutique hotel that felt like home, and that was the best part.

Look no further for your Sydney stay If you're looking for a comfortable, central hotel then look no further. Our room was well proportioned and clean, staff went out of their way to help us and our three year old daughter. Slap bang in the middle of everything tourist wise, it's about a ten minute stroll from Circular Quay and five minutes from Darling Harbour. Can't recommend this enough!!
rown was just fine! The Crown Plaza was very nice! It was perfect for an overnight stay before our cruise. We had no problems and they did not change for parking!! I would certainly stay there again.

Great Hotel Hotel was in excellent location, right around the corner from the Eiffel Tower, close to metros, restaurants, supermarket, shops. Room was very modern and clean. Breakfast was great. Staff were always very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone.

A wonderful place, but $$$$ This is a really nice hotel, but it's pretty expensive. The Hotel bar is awesome -- get a mojito or pina coladaParking is extra $15 or $ 20.The beds aren't all that comfortable. But it's a good plac

great location close to amenities, but nice and quiet on an evening. could do with a good clean and a lick of paint. rooms very basic but hey your only sleeping in them. if you have problems with stairs this is not the hotel for you. staff very friendly and helpful.

Excellent Hotel My wife and I just returned from a three night stay at the Hotel Regina in Barcelona. This hotel is highly recommended. It is very convenient to the main shopping street; the room that we had (#403) was situated at the front of the hotel - it was very comfortable and quiet; the staff is friendly and very accommodating - making dinner reservations, reconfirming air reservations, etc. I would definetely stay at this hotel should we make a return visit to Barcelona.

The quiet jewel in the quarter Was apprehensive about staying in the French Quarter with the sounds of a party echoing from Bourbon Street. But found this small hotel, only 1/2 block off of Bourbon, to be a quiet jewel. With a good hotels amenities and a friendly and helpful staff, I found myself able to complete my buisness and enjoy some of the nightlife made famous by Bourbon Street.
