I highly recommend the Hotel Saint Marie for buisness or pleasure.

Loved Tepi Sawah Tepi Sawah is a beautiful and tranquil boutique hotel just outside Ubud centre. The room and bathroom faces pretty rice fields and the volcano. The hotel shuttle provides transport to Ubud centre and back at your convenience. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Special thanks to Karda for helping to arrange a horseriding excursion!

Obsessed with this hotel! We got a great deal on Orbitz for this amazing hotel. The location is outstanding, smack between the Duomo and Piazza Signoria. We had a room facing the back, from which we could open our windows to overlook the picturesque Florentine rooftops and an overwhelming view of the Duomo itself! Our room was huge; comfortable and modern furniture, a very clean and beautiful bathroom (maybe a tad on the small side) but a separate sitting room with a sofa/twin bed and separate TV with its own amazing view. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Port hole window for 400 bucks We paid for a nice room we got an ok room (big enough) but with no window. When we booked we were told it would be a view of the harbour faicng Balmain. Sorry we got a port hole window and the staff lied about the other rooms. In the end we had to downgrade to get a view ( no money bacK).We will never go again.

Friendly, helpful staff The best part of Casci is the staff. They were very helpful with recommendations- directions, restaurants, etc. This was our second hotel in Florence, and compared to the first, Casci had a little more of a hostel kind of feel- signs in the bathroom asking you not to clean your laundry in the sink, for example. This was the quietest of all hotels we stayed at, which was nice. The location was great- down the street from the Duomo, street markets, and within walking distance of the train station.

Great Location Midtown, Trendy Spot Great place to stay in midtown Manhattan. Excellent rooms, friendly staff, spacious room compared to other places. Trendy and modern atmosphere, fashion magazines in lobby, etc. I would definitely stay there in the future. Restaurant Koi is great, and Cellar Lounge is hip for dancing/late night drinks.

Not so good anymore. Staff at this hotel are not so helpful and have a surly attitude. Rooms are outdated and the corridors smell. Should be closed and properly renovated. Bathrooms also are old and leaky.

Best hotel we've ever stayed in This hotel is absolutely suberb - perfect location (10 min walk to main shopping street and 15-20 min walk to Forbidden City / Tian'anmen Square); very efficient, helpful and friendly staff who speak good english; and the rooms / leisure facilities are excellent. Very good breakfast and the one evening meal we had there was first class too. All in all a perfect hotel from which to see Beijing from and the best hotel we've ever stayed in.p.s. when walking around Beijing take toilet paper with you as the public loos don't provide it!!
Old and Small The rooms are SMALL and outdated. Great location. The lobby was nice-comp. wine was rewarding and needed if you stay here.

A really lovely hotel in a lovely district close to all Hotel Monge was a lovely place to stay - really great value for a long weekend to celebrate our first wedding anniversary. Staff were very helpful, location amazing and metro so close - although Notre Dame and Latin Quarter was only 15 minutes walk. Mouffetard was a lovely district up very closeby, with great bars and restaurants - we loved 1001 Nights Morrocan bar with hooker pipes and Avocado milk shakes! The market at Mouffetard on Sunday was gorgeous - cheese meat fish coffee veg chocs baked goods....... etcetcetcAny way this was by far the best value stay in Paris, and saw some gorgeus quieter quarters as well as the main sights.

Colorful The Triton is in a great location right next to the gates of Chinatown. The good-Pet Friendly-Organic coffee and tea available in the lobby every morning-Aveda Toiletries-Soft bathrobes-Great wine reception-soft wonderful linensThe bad-Room size- Musty smell in some halls-shower only bathrooms-small elevators-smelly gym

Relaxed with the Reflexologist! I went to the Millennium Hotel with my husband and absolutely fell in love with the spa/pool area! The view of the city was breathtaking! They also offer reflexology sessions; our practioner, Rose was wonderful! I would definitely recommend stopping by the spa for an afternoon break!

Loved the hotel 5 of my girlfriends and I have just returned from Punta Cana and overall our visit was quite pleasant. The weather was great. The hotel was very nice, spacious and it had many options as far as food and restaurants. We highly recommend the restaurant 'La Res' - the food was superb. The only downfall of our trip was that we found most of the staff to be extremely rude and not very attentive and courteous. But overall it was a great memorial day get-away.

"A unique romantic place in the heart of the NYC !" What a great stay we had ! This hotel is a jewel hidden just a few steps from Times Square. The rooms are fabulous and the staff is extremely efficient and nice ! ..... We will definitely be back soon!

Excellent hotel, we'll stay there again. My wife and I enjoyed staying at this excellent hotel and will definitely stay there again whenever we are in Los Angeles. The room was excellent and the staff were pleasant and helpful. The facilities including restaurant, bar, grounds and laundry were excellent. We were impressed by the number of people we saw who were maintaining the hotel and grounds to a very high standard. Above average for a Holiday Inn and a hotel with character.

Should ne upgraded to a 4 star + I recently stayed 3 nights in this hotel with my mother and have to say we couldn't have picked a better hotel. I have stayed in many a four star hotel in Italy but none compare to this hotel. The staff were fantastic always on hand to offer friendly advice from where to go on day trips to which Restaurant to eat in. We stayed in room 501 which had a fantastic view and a good size balcony. I am planning to go back to Florence in September and would definately stay in the same hotel and with a bit of luck the same room.

Not too bad Having stayed here a number of times in the past the hotel is beginning to show wear a bit. Staff were pleasant and helpful throughout which is always as I have found it. The room facilities are as you would expect and the rooms are quite spacious (from a European point of view).I like this hotel because of it's proximity to the Central Rail Station where I can get into and out of the Airport quickly without relying on a taxi (or other transport).Food is of a reasonably good standard for breakfast. The Restaurant is highly regarded for it's Dutch food. The hotel is close to the nightlife centres without being on top of them - Dam Sq being about 5-10 mins walk.

Wow Wow Wow What more can one say. My wife and I stayed on the Name a Star package on our 18th anniversary and I tell you from the fantastic meal in Galileo to the unique naming of a Star for my wife to the room and Pool and massage, we had a stay that will be with us for the rest of our lives - we will most certainly shout out the praises of this fantastic hotel.

Great location This hotel is in a great location in terms of a walking distance to key Fisherman's Wharf attractions. From the Wharf area you can catch a trolley car or sightseeing bus to other parts of the City. Overall the hotel is great for the value. The lobby is large with a warm atmosphere and helpful concierge desk. The room we had was well furnished and clean, but it was small with no view; however, we were not paying a top rack rate and had no plans to spend much time in the room anyway.

stylish and central Loved this centrally located hotel. Great style, comfortable rooms, lovely bathrooms (with real showers--not so easy to find in Europe) Basement pool was perfect for relaxing before late dinners in town. Easy to walk to all sites. Our kids loved it too.

Sofitel Miami Style Over the years we have stayed many times at the Sofitel near the airport in Miami. We are always surprised at how good the service is and how clean, stylish, chic the rooms are. Granted, we are there on business, but it is a such a delight to find a great priced hotel with all the nice amenities and European service. I would recommend it over most of the airport area hotels.

Loved the Cambridge We stayed at the Cambridge Suites Hotel for a weekend. The rooms were spacious and clean with a big and very comfortable bed. We were upgraded to a room on the 21st floor and had a great view of the city. We had complimentary breakfast included which, while basic, was adequate. The location is also fantastic as it is one block from the Eaton Center and other attractions of the city. We will definitely stay there again if we go back.

This hotel was a gem! Let me start by saying that the couple that run the hotel are charming, helpful and welcoming. Free parking in San Francisco and a super neighborhood full of great shops and eateries. The room was superb. I will surely stay again.

Lovely Hotel Really enjoyed our weekend in this hotel. Read some other reports and decided not to stay in centre of Amsterdam. Train station was next door and took very little time to get into Amsterdam. Hired bikes outside hotel on our last day and had a terrific time cycling all around Zaandam - check out the lovely restaurants in Zaandam!!!MA Romsey Hampshir

Parisian Honeymoon This hotel is ideally situated in the Latin Quarter with a terrific view of the Pantheon. We actaully got the room we requested back in July. The staff was kind and curtious, made us feel truly welcome. Our stay in Paris was a dream come true.

very nice, perfect location !!! The location of the hotel is just perfect. The suites are very nice and compared to other standards not expensive at all (+/- 150 euros). The hotel has a very nice restaurant. I would go back immediately !

Nice place to stay The Residence Michalangiolo has fantastic rooms, and is run by the nicest freindliest people you could hope to meet. It is easy walking distance to the centre of Florence or there is a great inexpensive bus service. As there is no restarant and bar if you are hoping to meet other guests this hotel is not for you, but with a hotplate and fridge cleverly hidden in the room it is great if you want to do your own thing. You can drink your own drinks on a terrace or in the garden.

Good price and value for Miami I recently stayed at the Hyatt in downtown Miami and was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews on this site. The hotel is very conveniently located to the airport and downtown and is just a short cab ride to all the action in South Beach. The hotel was recently rennovated -- and my room was nicely furnished. The lobby was nice and the service I experienced at this hotel was excellent. You can't beat it for this caliber of hotel in Miami.

great hotel This was a great hotel- great walking distance to everything, and the hotel staff were very helpful and courteous! Clean rooms, nice breakfast in the morning. Perfect for me and my husband during our stay!

Dirty, dirty dirty!!! My most horrible hotel stay ever!Here is a short list:- stains all over the carpet- hairs and other dirt all over the bathroom- ironboard and iron were extremely dirty- blood and vomit in the staircase hall- cockroaches in the restaurant (this is not a joke)- unfriendly servantsOne advise: STAY AWAY !

Realy nice hotel, enjoyed staying there Really nice hotel. Modern, excellent beds, great location (even though is was near rembrandt square ti was very quiet), really helpful staff, breakfast ok, the bathroom was with glass walls so a little bit embarassing if you want your privacy. The price was a liitle bit high but i guess that's the standard price for amsterdam. The staff responsible for cleaning the room didn't do their best. I would definately recommend it.

Worst Hotel ever seen Very old and badly maintained hotel, just tidy. Unfriendly staff (except the shop keeper who's very helpful), special mention to the manager who is especially rude and unhelpful to his guests. On the whole, a very expensive and desappointing place. To avoid by any means!

Hotel Preciados was wonderful! We spent two nights at the Hotel Preciados after reading about it on Trip Advisor and we could not have been more pleased. The room was immaculate and spacious. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful to us during our stay, and although we prefer to walk rather than use public transportation, the hotel was close to the transportation systems. We would definitely stay at this hotel again!

getting better Having stayed here for the 3rd or 4th time over the years I have to say the Rho is getting much better. The rooms seem to have had a touch up and now appear much cleaner and brighter. The staff at reception are friendly and helpful as ever. Breakfast - well its edible and plentiful. THe location is the selling point - very good.

Excellent This hotel lived up to our high expectations and more. Check-in staff were friendly and helpful and presented us with a room upgrade and bottle of wine since it was our honeymoon. The room itself was spacious and well designed with plasma TV, DVD player etc. The buffet breakfast was exceptional - probably the best in any hotel I've had around the world - and well worth getting included in your rate if possible. The hotel location is good with some sights, shopping centres and a metro station nearby.

Great hotel I stayed in Residence Foch for valentines day in Feb 07 - location was perfect, staff were great. Room was very small but was perfect for us, it had all we needed including a minibar and a very nice bathroom. We stayed for three nights in total, it may be a bit small for people on a longer stay (1 week).As mentioned in other reviews, it have a more of a BB feel than a hotel feel so if you are looking for somewhere more like a hotel then I would look elsewhere. Would definetely recommend Residence Foch, the area was perfect, literally max ten mins walk from the Arc de Troimph, lovely safe area.

Happy -- Again Having booked a standard room for our second long weekend at Ku鈥檇amm 101, we were positively surprised to be given a comfort room for the same price. The young staff was very friendly and helpful, again. When the going gets tough in the breakfast room though, the service isn鈥檛 always up to speed. Important for those who like to sleep late : breakfast till 13.00 on Sunday is a nice touch. We鈥檒l be back.

Lovely Having stayed in the Sofitel in New York and thoroughly enjoying it - I decided to give the London one a try - and I wasn't disappointed. Very simply it was lovely!Concierge - helpful and friendlyFront desk - friendly and efficientRoom - absolutely lovely - particularly the shower! and spotlessly clean. Also really quiet due to very good double glazing - so between the quietness and the comfortable bed I had a fantastic night's sleep. Bar area - friendly. I was slightly worried that they might have been a bit pompous - but not at all!I would be delighted to have an opportunity to stay here again.

>Does the job ! A perfect place to crash whilst in transit through Frankfurt . This Hotel is clean, cheap, ideally situated next to the Central train station and staffed by friendly and professional people who do their jobs very well. It isn't exactly a Hilton / Sheraton but in so many ways is so much better ! A honest budget Hotel that will almost certainly exceed your expectations.

Location is just one feature here We had four great days here recently - location is fantastic given that there is so much within walking distance (including stadia and railway station), and if it rains (which is does here) transit is free in a large zone of downtown. Front desk staff could not have been more helpful and have a sense of humour, the concierge knew the answers to the questions we had, and the room was quiet and clean and comfortable. We will return....

Met or exceeded ALL expectations! We are a family of four (two adults and two daughters, ages 18 20). We stayed in one of the apartments for five nights and in two of the hotel rooms for one night. Only one negative to report--the new paint fumes in the hotel rooms on our last night. Other than that, I STRONGLY recommend this property. Very clean, very quiet, excellent location--two METRO stops close by, safe and secure, comfortable beds, friendly helpful staff, walking distance to excellent retaurants, reasonably priced.

Good hotel This hotel has a great location. within walking distance to a lot of bars and restaurants.rooms were nice, modern and very clean. Valet parking was expensive but probably the norm in the area!Concierge never at their desk! We always had to wait a while, looked like they were a bit short of staff!

Did not love the Chealsea Lodge First of all, I rely on Trip Advisor for my traveling. The room that I stayed in was horribly small. The TV didn't get great reception, the shower kept going from scalding to freezing, and there was a huge pipe in the room that kept whistling like a tea kettle. The cleaning staff was very friendly. However, when we explained to the problem with our room (whistling pipe), they were not willing to accommodate us at all.

A Beautiful Place in a Very Good Location Stayed here for three nights in June 2008, 2 adults and 2 teenagers in the annex rooms, second (third) floor. An absolutely beautiful place, clean and new with real Venetian decor (go to the Ca'Rezzonico museum and see the same style furniture you have in your room!). Breakfast was very good featuring home made apple croissants. I am a super light sleeper and on the first night heard noises from the private residence above our room - Walter and Sandro at the front desk contacted owner of the building the next day and immediately resolved the issue, they were super nice and helpful. Not hard to walk to this hotel from the train station - save some money on the overpriced vaporetto tickets and head there on foot.

Good for a Stop over We had a somewhat small room in the 鈥渢ower鈥?section of the hotel, which I think is mainly used by stopover passengers en route to Australia. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean and welcoming. Wardrobe space was somewhat limited after luggage storage and the small sit in bath required careful negotiation in order to stand in a flat area for a shower. The room although small was pleasant enough but the lighting was very poor and I found it very difficult to read standard size font (such as 11 of 12 point) after it had got dark.

It is the Flower of St. Charles Had never heard of this hotel, but was pleasantly surprised to find it looking great. Lobby is inviting, personnel helpful, lovely ambience, cannot say enough about the accomodations.. I would definitely stay there again now that I know about it. The only thing I would change is the hot water in the bathroom, it didn't get hot enough.

Good hotel, good location Stayed here for a few on nights on way to Sydney in November 04. Like a lot of other reviewers, i thought the room was small but in a place like Hong Kong you shouldn't be spending too much time there. Staff were friendly and helpful and some good info from the tourist desk. About 10 minutes walk from the busy streets of Causeway Bay, but 30 seconds from the MTR station and trams which are cheap and reliable (buy an Octupus card at the airport!).Tremendous, mainly unrestricted views over Hong Kong, harbour and Kowloon from the rooftop pool. Restaraunt a bit pricey, but reasonable value European/Asian buffet breakfast. No problems at night with karoke - although Bridge Over Troubled Water in Cantonese is interesting.

Great Customer Service at the Ramada We had a problem with our reservation when we arrived because we had not booked directly with the hotel and the hotel was full. However, they went above and beyond and gave us a special deal while spending forever on the phone with the internet company we had booked through. They were great!

Great Hotel!! I would recommend this hotel, great location and a great price. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms very comfortable and clean. If I visited San Francisco again I would stay here. The airport shuttle bus drops you off and picks you up right outside the hotel.
Quality hotel at great price Very clean. Free breakfast with good selections. Staff friendly and most helpful. A grat stay!

Excellent Staff Excellent hotel for the price. The staff are very helpful and friendly. Everyone speaks English. The hotel itself is very good, if you don't mind the staircase leading to it. Cosy and warm atmosphere,nice rooms though small, and close to all tourist sites and the trainstation. We will surely stay in that hotel next time.

Bad I stayed in this hotel in early March, although the location is excellent, we will not return to this hotel. We checked in at 2:30pm and the room was not ready. The room is nice but it is dusty. We had breakfast there in the morning, the food was cold and not replenished, very disappointing.

Truly amazing Returned on 12th June - it was fabulous. Even better than the photos!In addition to all the things other people say in their reviews aboutthe pool, drinks, food, luxury room etc, I especially liked the beautiful design of the resort and lovely touches like the wonderful selection of colourful plants and flowers, parrots, flamingos, fish etc. We also enjoyed the poolside activities eg Spanish lessons, Aqua Aerobics - thanks to the activity team who did a great job. My only complaint would be the Thomas Cook rep who was hopeless and the MyTravel flights to/from London Gatwick which were the most uncomfortable flights I've ever had the misfortune to take.

ice city shame about the hotel we stayed for 1 week in August 4-11th,2008, found hotel to be showing its age ,Doormen and staff very polite and courteous. But as a show Hotel for Boston ,I think it could do with some updating. As some people have said it is surrounded by some good buildings ,such as Trinity church and the Library,but is overshadowed by the monster skyscraper of the Hancock tower. I will not recommend this hotel to my friends or family as I believe more modern hotels exist in the city. What I can say is we experienced some history that the hotel showed in its makeup.

very good value We visited Berlin in June 2004 and found the hotel very clean and the staff were very helpful. The rooms were larger than expected and great value for money. The hotel was within walking distance of Alexanderplatz where there is a very efficient metro system serving most areas of Berlin. In the evenings we visited some bars within walking distance of the hotel but admittedly hard to find which were open very late. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Great location, friendly family-run hotel Nice family-run hotel in a great location - just a couple blocks from the Duomo, Galleria dell'Accedemia, and close to many other sites (although I do recommend taking a taxi from the train station if you have luggage - cost is only about 8 Euro from the train station to the hotel). The owners and staff are extremely accomodating, offering good advice to restaurants (their recommendation of Za Za's Tratorria was so good we went back our last night), tours and anything else you need to know. They made reservations for us for dinner and a tour and we were happy with each. They take pride in making sure everyone enjoys their stay.

Great Value! Aparthotel Silver is a good, clean, tourist class hotel in a quiet neighbourhood just north of the city centre. It provides excellent value compared with central hotels and offers a great buffet breakfast. Staff are friendly and helpful. Transport links are brilliant - the hotel is 80m from the metro station (Fontana) and then 5 minutes from the heart of the city (Line 3).

great place to stay Found it on my last visit to hawaii. Decided to stay there and everything was wonderful. The staff was great. The room was clean and modern. And the hotel is close to Waikiki Beach, close to all kind of restaurant and to all kind of store. We just loved it and we hope to return to Aqua Aloha Surf very s

Great Stay Had a great stay. The hotel is very comfortable, the room was surprisingly large for a major city. Everything was very clean and the staff were very friendly. The location is just off Times Square, but is not overly busy and is very convenient for getting around.

classy hotel Classy hotel, in a classy part of barcelona, near to all the sights, a bit of a walk to las ramblas so a bit further away from the party scene. very helpful staff, rooms very tastefully decorated with nice bathrooms. turn down service and a pillow menu! some of the rooms do differ considerably in size though, maybe ask for a larger room,,also the rooftop pool is only really aplunge pool but the rooftop is lovley to sit out and have a few relaxing drinks.breakfast very expensive!

very nice very nice hotel, and very clean!! the staff are extremely friendly. Would highly recommend to other couples and kids. The pool is brilliant with plenty to do for kids and plenty of pool activities. Restaurants are nice too.

Perpetual Guest We first found this hotel four years ago. Although the rooms are small, the privacy, ambience and staff more than make up for the lack of space. The bar, restaurant and reading room are unique and welcomed in an ever busy non-personal transit world of the traveller. Recommend to those who do not like the high end hotel chains but still want to benefit from the luxury.

Bad hotel, good location This is clearly not a 3 star hotel ! The staff is rather unpleasant, decoration is inexistant, rooms are tiny and beds are too soft, no air conditioning in the rooms which are just under the rooftop, and to finish breakfast is mediocre (no croissants or pancakes only bread, no choice in fruit juices etc...). The only good point is its location right on the Dam place.

Lovely hotel, brilliant location I loved this hotel and would recommend it to anyone. Brilliant location, loads of nice restuarants near to the Lodge and close enough to mid and downtown to make it easy to get everywhere else. Yes the rooms are small but they are perfectly adequate especially if you are planning to be out most of the time. Toilets were never busy and the whole place was clean and beautifully finished. I loved it!

Great Hotel My husband and I loved this hotel. We only stayed one night while on our way to the BVI to sail and have decided to lengthen next years trip so we can stay at this hotel and enjoy all it has to offer. The location lends itself to exploring Old San Juan in comfort and to enjoy the history of the area.

no problem with me I hesitated to book a room in this hotel because of the mixed opinions posted below, but I went on to reserve one mainly because of its location (undoubtedly the closest hotel from the central station). As it turned out, it was a pleasant stay. The lobby was great, the staffs were kind, the room was spacious and clean, equipped with a table and a separate study desk. The breakfast was rather expensive (20euro), so I chose to get food outside.

Loved our Spaulding Hotel Very good location, centrally located close to Theaters and shopping. We were given a nice quiet room on the 6th floor overllooking the pool of the adjacent hotel property. We traveled with our teenage daughter who enjoyed being close to the hip boutiques such as HM, Urban Ourfitter and Forever 21. The room had hard wood floors and was clean and cosy. The lounge on the second floor was really convenient and had washers and dryers which was super. We will stay here again!

Affordably Elegant If you don't need an elevator, this is a wonderful find in the Queen Anne district near Seattle Center. My room on the third floor was enormous, with separate well stocked kitchen and eating nook, living area with large couch, and recessed king sized bed, all very elegant and comfortable. Highly recommended.

Great hotel, good location The hotel is very good, rooms are sized right and breakfast is superb. The only low point are the beds, the matress are bit on the hard side. The location is great also, near Polanco and Condesa. Also the Turibus stops nearby

Very good time Returned 1/5 - first trip there. Apparently, less crowded than the week before. We had very good service all around. Also discovered one of the few people in the Caribbean who can remove a cork from the inside of an empty wine bottle - he is Luis the Maitre'd at Le Gourmet, one of the reservation only restaurants. If you go there, make it a point to see him.
False Impressions Bathroom is the size of 10yr. old girl's closet. Found a dead bug in the tub.

Great value This was m first trip to Florence and I thought that Hotel Axial was a completely wonderful value. It was clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was great. I plan on staying here again.

Great Place to Stay We stayed at the Seattle Sheraton 3 nights from July 1st. That was the second time we've stayed at the Sheraton and like the first time, we enjoyed our stay very much. The only thing was that it is under renovation so it was a little inconvenient but it was still a great stay. The rooms were very nice and the staff were very nice and helpful. If we went back to Seattle, we would definitely stay at the Sheraton.

A Doggie Hotel, Not for People The smell and stains in hallways and in rooms tells everything..... this hotel caters to people with dogs. We checked into our room and the stench of dog with potent cleaning solution smell practically knocked us over. The staff was friendly and tried to accommodate, but they said there weren't any rooms that were designated for just people. So if you don't mind paying to stay in a room where dogs have obviously been, then Summerfield may be just the place for you.

Kid Friendly in SF We stayed at the Argonaut last weekend for my cousin's wedding and were very impressed. The service was outstanding - both toward us and our 2 year old. We had a king sized room, which was fairly small, but well arranged, so we didn't feel cramped. The staff was very friendly and even brought our son a gold fish to take care of during his stay.

problems in paradise I was travelling on a family gathering in Miami, and my family booked at this hotel previously. I arrived at 2230 on a Thursday and Friday morning enjoyed the breakfast they offered, subsequently we left the hotel around 1430 on Friday and returned at 1600, on return luggage from our room had been stolen. My major concern was the way in which the hotel handled this, the first question they asked was should we call the police? I also noted that on return at least 3 room doors were opened by housekeeping and the rooms unprotected by employees, thus violating their own policy - to get into this hotel you have to go through a gate into a secured compound. My warning is this: the hotel accomodations are nice and pleasant, be very careful about your possessions and use the safe!

Great hotel, shame about the price increase! We enjoyed a fantastic Mother-Daughter trip to Paris in August and were very impressed by the quality/cost ratio of Regent's Garden Hotel. We got a really nice, recently refurbished twin room for only 99 Euro (booked direct on the hotels website).However, rather large negative: A few weeks later, having been so impressed by the hotel that I was planning a second trip back there to stay with my husband, I was told by the hotel that it had just been upgraded from a 3* to a 4* hotel and that subsequently the price has increased from 99 Euros for a Classic room to 169 Euros! A huge increase which dramatically changes the 'value for money' aspect of the hotel. While I would agree that an increase was warranted based on the refurbishment, it does not warrant a 70 Euro increase and it's a real shame as it puts a nice little hotel in the unaffordable category for a lot of people who would previously have stayed here (a comment I made to the hotel).
very bad hotel Very Good location but very very very bad hotel. The breakfast was not good. Allot off noise from the pipe in the room. Very Noise room. I will never stay there again.

Great Thanksgiving Stay Just returned from a stay here over the Thanksgiving holiday...4 nights. Very impressed with this hotel, wonderful location for the sights, spacious rooms, super staff. Considering that it's on busy 42nd St., this hotel is amazingly quiet. Security is excellent. If you want to be in the heart of things, I'd highly recommend the Hilton Times Square.

3 stars hotel... dream hollidays or a nightmare? if you want to go to Punta Cana choose another hotel to stay. The food was horrible, deteriorating rooms with a lot of mosquitos and a few cockroachs, rout towels at bathroom... and we buy it like a 5 stars.... it was a nightmare.

Great front desk staff Purchased via hotwire, so was unsure what I was in for. Very pleasantly surprised. Great location, nice clean room, a large glass of free wine nightly between 6 -7 pm was a bonus. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful, assisting with confirming tours I had booked prior to leaving. I sat chatting with them one day, they provided maps and routes for sightseeing etc..

Good location, comfy beds Rooms were great although the bedroom area was a little on the small side, the bathrooms and comfortable beds really made up for this. All sights within easy walking distance - 5 mins walk to the flower market and 15-20 mins to Museumplein. Near to metro, trams and canalbus stops. Just round the corner from the hotel is Utrechtsestraat which contains some of the best restaurants in Amsterdam. During our stay there was a lot of unexpected construction work (both to us and the hotel) which the hotel kindly compensated us for. Would definitely stay here again.

Great base for seeing LA We were very pleased with our stay at the Holiday Inn Universal Studios (formerly known as the Beverly Garland). Although it is a bit noisy due to proximity to Highway 101, it didn't stop us from sleeping and the proximity to 101 meant driving around was easy. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the pool area was great and the food in the restaurant was excellent. Altogether great value for money.

Elegant Hotel, excellent position, but some minor flaws We stayed here in late September 2003, and would recommend it for position, and its effortless elegance and style. A five minute walk from the Duomo and various excellent side-street restaurants make it a very strong choice. That said, those minor flaws: as in other hotels, rooms vary in quality from tired and jaded to newly refurbished with Tuscan pain effects - so negotiate for the better ones. Breakfast was mediocre with catering being run by an outside conmtractor! Be prepared to part with $25 a day for parking as well. But overall the setting- especially the roof-top bar terrace - gave this a very strong rating.

Fabulous place in Florence My sister and I spent seven days at IlGuelfoBianco in Florence and wish it had been longer. The staff goes out of their way to be friendly and helpful. Their information on the sights of Florence was very accurate and they did not hesitate to make helpful suggestions. The rooms are beautifully restored with historical furniture. We felt that we found our home away from home.

Great amenities for the price If you want a first class or corporate hotel in a nondescript cityscape, then stay away from the Perak, instead book at one of the glass and concrete boxes on Orchard Road. The Perak is not like the big chain hotels but is a great value for the money in Singapore. For around $70USD per night you get a clean (albiet small) room, with basic but nice appointments(Cable TV, A/C, DVD, free wireless internet, etc), a good location in vibrant Little India, and basic but tasty buffet breakfast. I had no complaints other than a bit of street noise late at night when a neaby bar was closing up. But the cheapest rooms at the Perak have a skylight rather than a window and are much quieter if noise is an issu

Great Location We stayed for a week and had a great time. The staff is wonderful, friendly and will help you as much as possible. The hotel鈥檚 location is great, convenient to the train station, shopping and lots of restaurants. We will definitely stay here when we come back.

Great Hotel! Rydges World Square Hotel in downtown Sydney was a wonderful, classy, comfortable hotel. The staff were excellent, the room well-appointed and it was located right downtown with many services nearby including a number of internet cafes so that you can catch up with happenings a world away. I would certainly recommend it.

Great for the price My boyfriend and I stayed one night at the Vibe Hotel and I thought, for price and location, you can't beat it. They had just recently undergone a massive renovation and the rooms were modern and comfortable and included any amenity we could have asked for -- minus complimentary towels at the rooftop pool which was slightly annoying since we called down to housekeeping 3 times and were clearly ignored. So basically, aside from lack of towels at the pool, out stay was comfortable and hassle free and exactly what we were looking for.
Da wurde ich i m Verlauf der Jahre gerne Stammgast!!! showReview(22676294, 'full');

lose to Convention Center About 2 blocks to convention center. Stay here on business if main purpose is convention center. Wouldn't stay here for vacation. Not in a very good area, not close to any restaurants. Walls are very thin. Rooms are clean.

fast lifts This is a smart hotel with slow checking in service. Close to Macy's for shopping. We had a room with two double beds , but the beds were very small for double beds. The hotel is used by lots of airline staff and the information desk was very helpfull for maps and sightseeing info.

The best. We booked this hotel at the last minute - and what a pleasant surprise. It is more expenseive than we would usually pay - but it was worth every penny. The staff were ever so helpful and the suite had everything you could think of. The hotel is well located for business in the West End and for shopping - we will be back.

Nice hotel We stayed for two nights in early April and found the hotel to be in a good location with comfortable accommodations. The staff was also helpful with directions, finding hours for museums, etc. It is not as warm and hospitable as a BB, but for a busy city like Florence, it is comfortable and I can definitely recommend it.

Good airport hotel Nice hotel close to the airport. Our room was on the top floor and was a non-smoking room that was still a little stuffy (smokey?). I stayed at this location about 8 years ago for the first time. Overall, this hotel has been well managed/maintained over the past years. I would recommend it if you have a late arrival or early departure. It also has a nice breakfas

Nice hotel- good location This is a very nice hotel in a great central location. Staff were friendly and it was clean and well maintained. I found the room and beds to be a bit small by comparison to other hotels and the bar and lobby bar were a bit stuffy and boring for young people. On the whole though a really nice hotel.

Expensive but worth every cent What a lovely hotel. I arrived after a difficult trip from Milan to the comfort, luxury and top flight airconditioning of the hotel Gallery Art (an essential in the middle of August).In contrast to other Italian hotels I experienced, the staff were consistently delightful and superbly helpful at all times. The location is unsurpassed being right on the Arno and next to the Ponte Vecchio. I unhesitatingly recommend it and will stay nowhere else when I return to Florence.

Great stay at El Convento Spent 3 nights at El Convento. Great location, our room was very nice, and service was excellent. Everyone was helpful with booking tour, restaurant recommendations and reservations, etc. We spent a day at the beach at their affiliated hotel La Concha, which was excellent. We would recommend highly.

A Superb Hotel Stayed on the way to the QM2. A superb first class hotel with nice views from the top of the hill. Trolly from outside to Fishermans Warf. What one would expect from a horel with the address Nob Hill!

Stylish, friendly and first class The location of this hotel is second to none. it is also quiet - especially if you ask for a room at the rear of the property. The delux rooms are very spacious, luxuriously appointed and comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great - especially the coffee - a great place to stay.

The Astor Crowne Plaza is a wonderful hotel We enjoyed our stay at the Astor Crowne Plaza. It is located in the French Quarter, which is a great place to visit. The service was excellent especially, Susie who was very friendly and helpful during our stay. I recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to experience a true New Orleans adventure.

Excellent service at a cost Good location on a side road of Orchard Road, but not necessarily the best location as Orchard Road is like Oxford St in London, busy and full of tourists. The service was amazing, using your name when you check in, giving you a butler etc. Rooms are excellent, well appointed and a descent size, pure luxury. Concierge and all the staff very helpful, however I did find the cost of drinks a little on the steep side, as was breakfast. Pool a little disappointing, more of a large plunge pool.

Decent with good quality/price ratio, but noisy The hotel is in a good location, the rooms, at least the low priced one i got, are really small although you can survive for a week if you just sleep in there. The window in my room was loose and the first two nights it was not properly warm. I tried to put the room temperature regulation on, but the fan was really noisy, so i opted for an extra blanket. My room was facing the rear street and it was rather noisy early in the mornings. On the average, i would suggest this place, at least for the cheap rooms, to the budget conscious traveler.

Mediocre cleaning, mediocre breakfast buffet Was not asked about room preference at check-in and got one stinking with old cigarettes. Happily we were offered a non-smoking room within 30 minutes after we complained. The glasses and cups we used in the room were not changed by the cleaning lady, just wiped off. The breakfast buffet was ok, but not up to the standards one should expect from a 4-star hotel. Personell was nice and service-minded, though.

Discreet Charms Of The Neri On Tripadvisor comments I booked this hotel for a short 4 day break - we weren't disappointed. It is the perfect small hotel with the emphasis on quality rather than quantity. Having travelled extensively, far too many hotels rely upon offering a plethora of services that guests will never use. The Neri, in common with good hotels, simply concentrates on providing excellent accomodation where a good nights sleep is guaranteed, excellent assistance from the helpful staff, and a wonderful location for sightseeing. The hotel deserves to succeed.

Bravo! We could not have been more pleased with the warm reception and excellent service provided at Hotel Casci. The rooms were well appointed and clean, the bathrooms were a nice size. The owners and staff were very knowledgeable about the area - went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. I definitely recommend!!!

Wonderful vacation! We stayed for 2 nights in a room we got a special deal on. This was a beautiful hotel, the decor and ambiance was exactly what we were hoping for. The pool and hot tub area was amazing, although we had hardly any time to relax we were so busy touring LA. The staff was friendly and helpful. We also ran into some late night filming of CSI right outside the hotel which was a great experience.

Expensive and nice We stayed in a Century Suite and it was really comfortable, quite and spacious. Be careful with the minibar in the room, because you have to pay for items at the moment you move them. But in spite of that I would come back to the same room and I recommend it.

lovely hotel We stayed here the 9th feb just for one night and really enjoyed it. We were upgraded on arrival to a superior room which was lovely! Its only a couple of minutes walk from the tube station. The hotel is lovely and modern and the breakfast buffet was nice too. Would deffinately stay here again and recommend to others.

Must have been in a different hotel than others Seeing all the rave reviews of this place, I must have been at another hotel, there is nothing decent in downtown NO, or its clientele is too young and/or drunk to know any better. Desk service is condescending, except for the sheets rooms are really not well-maintained, carpet is badly stained, and everything is worn-out. Good but noisy location with thin walls. Downstairs breakfast restaurant looks mediocre and expensive, though the night club looks intrguing. Would stay again only if stuck. Tip: Unless the season is very busy, you can probably get very deep discount coupons at Visitor Center, so don't reserve ahead.

Nice stay, little expensive Nice place Nice rooms bigger than regular NY hotelsI travel with kids , so place with TV and other ammenities good enough, nice rooms, just renewed, myabe a poor service inbathroom supplies, but nice, I think for the same price I paid i can book a room at the Waldorf, but little smaller room. By the hotel there is a Restaurant and good service and nearby area there is a nice places to dine out. Walking distance to NY Natural History Museum.

Great Value!! We stayed for 2 nights, and it was better than we expected. Free parking (great bonus), nice neighboorhood with good restaurants and stores, if you need them walking distance, and very friendly service. Walking distance to Fishermans Warf . Good value.

a warm and intimate hotel in a big city We recently spent a long weekend at The Benjamin. I have to agree with all the previous positive posts. The location is good, the room was great, the bed comfortable, the staff friendly without exception. The only problem was that our refrigerator did not work properly and they were not able to fix it during our stay. We plan to stay at The Benjamin again soon.

Reviews are right on for this one We stayed at the Cancellor Hotel in July during part of our honeymoon. The reviews on this website are right on spot regarding the hotel. The hotel is older and the rooms are smaller but very clean and the staff is very helpful. They made our honeymoon special with champagne and a gift in our room at check in. On a side note, we loved the restaurant next door for breakfast called Sears.

AWFUL HOTEL! There is no way this is a 4.5 star hotel, more like a 1 star. The room was big, but dirty walls and horrible lighting. Very noisy and very uninformed staff. It has completely made me not want to ever stay at a Radisson Hotel again.

wonderfully comfortable We stayed for three nights April 2004. The room was very spacious and comfortable in every way. Enormous choice at the huge buffet breakfast and the best pool/ sauna/ health club we had ever used. Near all the sights-- if a little qiet at night but all in all a luxurious place to stayin a great location.

Excellent Hotel Great hotel , with very good service , clean rooms - small but very comfortable .The hotel is in the best area , few minutes by walk from Tiannamen and the Forbidden City and the staff is very kind and always is posible to find that at least one of them speack a good English. Service in the desk is good and with a smile .De breackfast is tasteful , with all that's necessary to start the day with a good feeling. I reccomend it for every one , its a great experience with a convenient price .

very good experience at this hotel Stayed for 2 nights while touring through Texas. Located to the north of the city but convenient for attractions (if you have a car). we did the JFK museum in downtown Dallas before heading over to Fort Worth Stockyards and then to Southfork Ranch so you can do these attractions in a day from this base. Nice restaurants and other facilities. Excellent well appointed room at very competitive rate. Overall a very good experience and would recommend this hotel.

Nice hotel, great price for NY Stayed in the Sofitel June 28-30 2003. The Sofitel is in a very good location, one block from Times Square. The rates are very good, try Expedia or their website. The room had a very comfortable queen bed, with turndown service and a nice bathrobe. The bathroom was large and clean, with good toiletries. I plan to stay here again on my return trips to NY.

Satisfied I stayed here for 3 nights. Check in was brisk and the room was adequate - neat, not too large yet not too small (considering this is Hong Kong). Location was good, near the hustle and bustle of Times Square. For everything else, there is always the MTR!

Good Hotel Booked a package through Eurostar, a nice modern hotel near the peripeherique, 5 mins walk to the metro and then 15 mins into the centre of Paris. In the centre of conference / tradeshow town so could be busy. A good room, clean and tidy and attentive staff. A check in problem was expertly and politely solved. bar expensive and you are better off taking breakfast in a local bar than the hotel (15 euro buffet anyone?). Recommended for a long weekend, we'll stay there again.

Great Little Boutique Hotel! The Hotel Londra is a beautiful little hotel with great accommodations, excellent service by the hotel staff, and the best dinner that we had in Italy was at the restaurant in this Hotel. Breakfast is served each morning, with a generous choice of bakery, meat, egg, fruit, and drink choices. While the location is a bit of a walk from the center of town, we enjoyed walking and seeing the community every bit as much as we enjoyed all of the historic sites. Our room was clean, spacious, and we enjoyed a magnificent view which was perfect at sunset. We will definitely stay at the Hotel Londra the next time we are in Florence.

Fantastic location We stayed here for one night on the 3rd leg of our Honeymoon and it was fantastic, we had a suite with a little kitchen and a lounge and a large bedroom. We were travelling with our 7 year old little girl. The location was great as it was only a 10 - 15 min walk to the CN Tower which was great. In the morning we received a complementary breakfast which was great and it set us up for the day. Would definatly stay here if we returned to Toronto.

Value for money The location is excellent right next to Centraal Station. The rooms are small but cleanBreakfast is adequateFree Porn channel for those interested. To sum up it is what it is a cheap hotel at a cheap price. If you want a luxorious hotel pay more and get one if you just want a nice clean cheap room in an excellent location. This is for you.

Fantastic service I am a travel agent booking hotels all over the world, so we are very very fussy. This hotel offers customer service at its' best. Great location, great service, nothing is too much bother. The rooms are great, cheaper than some of the well known names and frankly far better. Stay here and give yourself a treat with staff who really do genuinely care. We will continue to book our clients here, as it gives a great satisfaction to offer them such an outstanding property.

Lovely hosts, but catered towards Americans The hotel is quaint with a lovely terrace and nice hosts, but seemed as if this place was more geared towards americans, with some surprise at guests that are not americans (i.e. us). This is probably due to the american wife of the owner couple. Unfortunately this made the hotel seem less diverse, whereas Florence is very diverse!!The rooms are large, but some features such as bathrooms do need updating. Breakfast is not included, which is a shame as many hotels in Italy offer it.

Loved It After reading the reviews on this site, I was terrified of my choice, but had already paid in full through Expedia. The hotel turned out better than I expected and I completely relaxed. Room was charming, although it was the absolute smallest hotel room that I have ever stayed in, and the bathroom was really itty bitty!Didn't have much contact with the staff, but what contact I did have was pleaseant. I arrived at the hotel at 11 a.m. was allowed to check in, which helped me enjoy a full day in San Francisco without worrying about check in times, etc. I took Bart from the airport and highly recommend it over taking a $40 or more taxi ride.

Excellent Not much more to say. I'm pretty picky about hotels but this a great place in every way. I agree with the last reviewer about not wanting too many people to find out about this place. Location is pretty much next to the Accademia and not far from the Duomo. Service is great and the people working at the desk are extremely friendly and helpful.

Expensive but good Since years I stay at the Westin Hotel when in Tokyo. Okay, it's expensive and the rooms not furnished according to my taste - but in general it's a very oppulent hotel with good service. Don't miss the breakfast.

great styling Great styled hotel. got a good deal on the internet for the room with breakfast. Breakfast restaurant were good. Prices at bar were high (800ml of water 拢5!).Door closers are a bit fierce and there were regular lod bangs from doors closing (didn't stop us sleeping though)!.Very close to Tower Hill Tube and easy to get into the city centre. Very close to Tower of London and Tower Bridge.

Superior Hotel Anyone visiting Paris should stay in this hotel, the location is perfect, the hotel is immaculate and charming and we cannot say enough about the service. Farooq and the entire staff were welcoming,helpful, and very generous. If you want an amazing Paris experience, stay here!

loved the hotel a truly grand dame in boston. hotel is clean, staff is professional, they call you by last name when you check your car. gracious, attentive, spectacular bathrooms, guestrooms. all housekeeping are gracious and attentive. this is my third time visiting this fine hotel.

Spectacular This hotel is spectacular in both its features and its service. I absolutely loved everything about the hotel, from the elegant lobby area, to the comfortable and spacious guest rooms to the incredible dining room. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston. It is in a good location and close to alot of shops and restaurants.

Great Views, Great Hotel I had the pleasure of staying here for a few days and must say that this is one of the better hotels in the country. I was in room 3905 which had a great view of the golden gate bridge in the background. Staff can't do enough for you, they always call you by name. Didn't eat in the hotel restaurant Silks, but everything else in the hotel is top notch. They had a good rate of $395 a night for a room which normally sells for $610 a night.

lub is great! We stayed here for 3 nights in club and although the rooms are on the small side and showers lack any real power it was Jean and Joyce,the concierge, that made our stay here more than comfortable. They arranged everything from reservations in the best restaurant in the South West (Binkley's) to a hot air balloon ride over the desert, they just could not do enough! The Club lounge is exactly as a lounge should be, full of great food and masses of free drinks all through the day and more information about the area than you can shake a library at. Would highly reccommend, but only in club.

A home in Sydney I had a short but very pleasant stay at the Altamont. Large and nice rooms, excellent central situation and above all relaxed atmosphere and friendly, very helpful staff. Thanks Alan. Max

11 days in HK We stayed at the South Pacific Hotel from 07/03/2006-16/03/2006 and found our stay to be most enjoyable. The hotel is quite basic,with a bar fridge and kettle,very clean and well located in Wanchai,with shops (two good bakeries nearby) and Times Square an easy walk, transport is very close. The concierge, the doorman and the cleaning staff were very friendly and attentive. The twin bed room was more spacious than the double room, the beds are easy enough to push together. We would have no hesitation in returning to this budget hotel.
Sehr gut f眉r 2 Sterne showReview(11342410, 'full');

wonderful benefits I was thrilled when I called Seattle Pacific Hotel and was given a fantastic weekly rate. During my stay all personnel were always responsive to my needs. I had a very late flight out of Seattle the day I left, and I was allowed to stay longer in my room with no extra charge. All the people at the hotel were very accommodating. I will definitely stay there again. Lucy Wrigh

Good Hotel Above standard 5 * hotel. The staff are friendly and helpful and eventhough they were very very busy they managed to check us in early!! The rooms are standard, but the bathrooms are exceptionally big and nice. The best part of the hotel is the easy reach of all the places in Singapore and their Bar with good cocktails and amazing view of the skyline of Singapore.

Mother's Day weekend Considering the price of $65/night (Priceline) it was a great stay. We had 3 rooms, all with 2 beds, at this rate and it's our 3rd year in a row winning this hotel. We use the parking lot just outside the hotel for overnight parking ($10/night), love the coffee shop for a quick snack or breakfast and haven't had issues w/the staff, service or anything.

Everything was perfect The Duquesne was a perfect place for us. The view was spectacular, rooms comfortable/clean, breakfast (complete with eggs, ham, cereals and assorted pastries) more than expected. The front desk was kind and helpful, especially for a lost suitcase. This trip was for my daughter's sixteenth birthday and she loved it. Only two blocks to metro and five minutes walk to Eiffel Tower.

Superb breakfast view Ok, I'm a little biased because Berlin in the snow in mid-February is inspiring, but this was a superbly located hotel, with great facilities and very helpful staff (whose English is far better than mein Deutsche). My girlfriend pointed out that were it slightly further up the Ku'damm, by only about 75 metres, it would be more expensive to reflect the slight-change in area, so it really is a bargain. I've never been in a hotel where for such little outlay you have a MASSIVE bath in a marble bathroom, set in a large, well laid-out clean and comfortable room. My top tips would be to have the (very ample buffet) breakfast there, whilst enjoying the view from the 6th floor -fruhstuck even runs until 10, so you can still have a bit of a lie-in; and to get a City/ Welcome card, as the hotel is very close to stations for all the forms of transport (except trams, being located in the West), thereby utilising its much raved about location. We would eagerly use it again.

Fantastic Kapok - loved it! We loved the Kapok so much we stayed there 3 times over a 3 week period while coming and going from Beijing! It is in a fabulous location, is modern and funky, has a great bar and restaurants and fantastic staff. Added to this was the excellent price. We'll definitely go back.

Just awful I wasn't able to sleep at this hotel. The door between rooms was not sound-proofed, and TV in the adjoining room was turned up all the way. Though I called the front desk twice about it, they were unable to hear the TV from the hallway and therefore didn't do anything about it. I would not recommend this hotel.

Multiple Great Stays For the 3rd time in recent months stayed at the Sheraton Metro Center, off Dunlap Ave and the Black Canyon Freeway (I-17 N). Received upgraded status on 2nd and 3rd stays in addition to the normal Gold Member service that have come to expect from Sheraton Hotels. Great service, very friendly staff and they serve an excellant complementary full American style breakfast. Easy access to the Metro Center Mall as well as easy via I-17 to Phoenix Sly Harbor Airport. Will definitely stay again when in Phoenix area.

Fine but pricey stayed here for a long weekend - nice hotel and obviously can't beat the location - we were in the castle club which is worth the extra money as had 'character breakfasts' every morning - that way you can gets lots of photos and avoid eating in the hotel for lunch and dinner - had the buffet at the Inventions restaurant one night which was awful - go up to the Disney Village if you want to eat something decent for half the price - there is a planet hollywood and a few other acceptable chains in the village - good standard of room but OD'd on the air freshner - very comfy beds - staff were fine - kids loved the weekend though which is the whole point - still considering the cost could make a better effort to feed the grown ups

Better than expected Stayed here for a conference located at the hotel. Based on previous reviews I wasn't quite sure what to expect but I was pleasantly suprised. The room was clean and large, nice bathroom/dressing room set up. Conference facilities and food were above average. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Silly Style Over Substance I spent two nights at the W recently and had to supress myself from laughing on several occasions. The pool has the letters WET printed on the bottom - thanks, I would never have guessed... This place has pseudo-hip styling flourishes that serve no purpose and dance music is piped into every conceivable public area ( gym, elevators,lobby,restrooms, etc.). As you approach the main entrance, large motorized drapes automatically part and reveal - a staff of slacker twentysomethings ! Overall, those over age 26 may want to look elsewhere.

Superb location and wonderful room We stayed in room 609 at Swissotel from 9th to 11th August to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The location is superb right by Dam square with many great bars and restuarants only a short walk. It only took about 15 mins to walk from central station. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and our room was excellent with all amenities and a huge ensuite. Everything was extremely clean and tidy, would definately return again.

Ideal hotel We really liked this hotel, we were originally booked for the Kempinsky but due to a mix up we couldn't get in, and booked this very much last minute. The hotel is a little tired however they are working on that and it will be rectified, the breakfast was wonderful with lots of choice. All in all we would definitely stay here again. If you are going to Berlin for a few days and know how to ride a pushbike we would strongly recommend the fat tire bike company, nothing too strenuous, but a great way of seeing the city.

Highly recommend this quiet 2 star No more doubt as to where to spend a night or two in Paris. This two-star hotel is above average, well kept, well organised, honest and forthright. The hotel team was quick and eager to help with any projects: my wife and I felt we were a respected part of things, and Paris became accessible and comprehensible for us. We recommend the Hotel Monte Carlo.

We'll be back We will definitely stay at the Benjamin again. Great hotel. Nice decor, friendly staff, immaculately clean and a good location. Our room was on the back of the hotel, so no view, but very very quiet. Fantastic mojitos in the lounge bar!

Elegant serene I went back a second time this summer because I loved this small, chic and most restful of hotels. Outside is a magnificent view of the river for which the hotel is named and parallel is a cobblestone street filled with a wide range of charming shops. I am going back a third time this year because this hotel is so attractive.

dont do it unless u have 2 dont stay here unless you have to . the blankets were dirty.... stains everywhere and that wasnt the only reason i had a bad stay. thin walls and loud sounds coming from all directions left me awake and wishing i had slept anywhere else.

Great! We went there a couple of weeks ago and I really think this resort is worth a recommandation. The whole resort is really beautiful, friendly people everywhere, big rooms who are well cleaned every day, nice food for everyone and a great 'holiday-spirit'! You must try it!
peace and quiet the service was wonderful! They were very friendly. Great location easy to get to Union square The rooms are fabulous. The bathrooms are huge, and great closet space.

There are better choices I stayed at the Shinjuku Washington, hoping to save a bit of money on a trip to Tokyo. The hotel lobby was in a chaotic state and the staff were not particularly helpful or courteous. My room was clean, but truly tiny and in need of refurbishment. I had to pay extra to leave my luggage for a couple hours after check-out. I would prefer spending more for a nicer hotel, such as the Century Southern Tower in the same area or the Mercure Ginza.

Average..!!!! Good value for money, very clean and OK breakfast. The position is excellent and only a stones throw from central station. The only downside was, that some of the staff could have been more attentive and friendly. We shall probably stay elsewhere next time but still in the same location. Amsterdam is Fantastic, we love it there.

Highly recommend the Berchielli We spent 2 nights at the Berchielli last week, and the experience was completely delightful: perfect location (on the river, an easy walk to the Ponte Vecchio); friendly, attentive staff; spotless, attractive rooms; and an excellent (hot) American breakfast. Other family members had spectacular river views through 2 huge windows in their rooms. My single room, which I referred to as the princess room, since you went up 2 flights of stairs to enter the sleeping/bath area after you came in the door, had no view, but was so delightfully quiet that I happily accepted the trade-off. The size of the hotel was perfect, with a boutique atmosphere. I loved Florence, and will hope to have the opportunity to return and enjoy the Berchielli again.

firmed reservation, but no room available when we arrived I reserved two rooms several months in advance and confirmed them via email one week before arrival. Nonetheless, we were apologetically told by the staff that they had overbooked and had no rooms available and were transferring us to its sister hotel Colon. Unfortunately, the Colon Hotel rooms turned out to be run down, with stained upholstery, linens, and carpeting, no air conditioning, and an old, lumpy bed. We found a new hotel. I never saw the rooms at the Regencia, so I can't comment on them (the lobby was simple but clean), but the experience was disappointing and stressful as we scrambled to find an acceptable hotel.

xcellent hotel Clean, Good food, Excellent staff, Very freindly people. good value for money as everything included (breakfast taxes). Good location, just opposite central station and tram station and around the corner for everything else. Excellent selection of tourist information in the foyer and in rooms. you must go on the walking tour, buy a guide of old city from hotel reception.

Mixed review We celebrated my husband's 60th birthday and I had booked 4 rooms. We had problems with the final billing for 3 of those bills. I received an internet rate of $64 a night, but the bill indicated $127 and we were charged for a valet service that we did not have for one room. Check your billing statement. Also, the rooms were very small and our view was the room of the building next store, but for $64 I can't complain. On the other hand, great location and the staff are very nice.

Easter in San Francisco We had a very nice clean room with plenty of towels for our family of four. We did not use the restaurant, but found many places within walking distance for all meals. The wharf area has plenty of eateries and things to see. This Sheraton is not a resort - so we didn't expect to dine, swim, or exercise while visiting. This is a clean safe place to stay while visiting a major US city.

Happy Mardi Gras!!!!! Owned by the Monteleone family, this is a wonderful place that has to be appreciated in a botique hotel perspective. Rooms great, some have only showers, slow elevator but who cares, more time to visit. Staf we had were all superb and the price especially for MardiGras weekend was superb. Had stayed there several years back and it has gotten better with age:)

Too expensive, but clean and big room The hotel is situated right next to Dam sqare, in a quiet area. Location is more than perfect, walking distance to the main attractions (red light d, shopping, dam, bejighoff, central station, flower market, rembrandt, picasso).Don't expect the nice treats of a 180eur/night hotel. however, the room was quite large (around 18sqm) with a large bathroom, very clean.

Highly Recommended We were looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location and found this to be the perfect choice. Although it is not especially plush the Moore Hotel is spotlessly clean and the staff were very helpful. If you want to see all that Seattle has to offer you cannot be in a better location - two blocks from Pike Street Market with Macys and other major stores 2 blocks in the other direction. The 'tour bus' stop is just a 2 minute walk away which takes you all around Seattle and stops at all the major attractions.

lean/affordable/bit older decor All the staff of this hotel were most accommodatingand very friendly. Hotel has alot of charater and the rooms were clean. However, they were a bit on the older side and could use some updating. The location is fantastic for the theatre districtand dining options. Also convenience stores andbakeries are close by. Good price/service/location.

Great Stay Booked a package through Trailfinders, great deal (usually book everything myself). On check in had been upgraded to a suite. Wonderful service, couldn't fault anything. Hotel location good near everything we wanted to see. Would stay again .

xcellent hotel and city Just come back from Beijing, stayed 7 nights at the Crown Plaza, this is an excellent hotel, good location, spotless rooms, great service especially in the champagne bar! booked on the hotel website and payed 拢400 for the room for a week, an excellent price for this level of hotel. a few tips, make sure you get a metre taxi from the airport, and that the metre is used (we had no problems with this) cost to wangfujing street should be 90/110 yuan about 拢7.00, and takes about 40 mins. taxi to the great wall 600 yuan, that includes waiting for as long as you like we were their about 3 hrs, recommend the wall at Mutianyu, takes about 1.5 hours to get to. Great resturant is buffalo at Houhai lake, you will have a great time in this fab city!
Great stay We spent 2 nights at the Benjamin. Centrally located, very nice and clean room. Staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend it.

All-Round Excellence We stayed at the Embassy Suites Reforma during January 2008, and we loved it. It had a very convenient central location on the beautiful tree-lined Paseo de la Reforma. The rooms were very comfortable and quite large, and we were very impressed with the service - staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, from the concierge to the bell-boys.

Loved the Halekulani Spent over a week at the Halekulani in February, what a wonderful hotel. Friendly staff, beautiful room and peaceful surroundings. The beach area is nonexistent, but the pool is just beautiful. Be sure to get the sunrise package - The House Without a Key Orchids both serve an excellent breakfast. I recommend a visit to the hotel's spa as well.

Jewel in the rough internet special rates made this a very affordable stay in an expensive area of the country, especially since i had pets with me. the staff was friendly and accommodating. the room was surprisingly clean, especially for an older facility. the hotel is convenient to area highways and very accessible to long beach.

Go for it!! Great location-very central but tucked away from the neon-lit main streets. Very nice staff-problem getting hot water in the morning, but they were very accommodating. Breakfast is well presented all tastes are catered for. Rooms clean and simply decorated. Would recommend to anybody!

Excellent Hotel - great location Excellent location, right next to Gran Via Metro station and within walking distance of many of the tourist attractionsWe had a nice room with a balcony, which enabled us to see all the way down the Gran Via. The free mini-bar was a bonus and the free glass of cava in reception was also a nice touch. Breakfast had many options and the staff were pleasant and courteous throughout. We booked the Senator on the back of positive reviews here and they were not wrong. Highly recommended.

My "Go To" Hotel in SFO Great location near Market Street, Union Square and Theatre District. Best indoor swimming pool in the city for short laps. In-and-out parking allowed. Rooms are very comfortable, tastefully decorated and impeccably clean. You get more than you pay for!
Phenomenal One of the best hotels ever. The service is wonderful. The accommodations were comfortable, clean, and first rate. I can't say enough about this hotel. The location is fantastic as well.

Very centrally located We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and were very pleased with our choice. The hotel was less than a 5-minute walk from the Shinjuku Station and close to everything (shops, restaurants, etc). Although the rooms were a bit tiny as are all Tokyo hotel rooms I was told, they were very clean. The lobby was nicely designed with modern decor; very stylish and chic. Overall, we had a wonderful time staying at the Sunroute Plaza.

Great French Quarter Classic This Hotel is it in New Orleans. I work in the Hotel field and believe me - this place spares no expense and gives you your money's worth. Excellent staff and the location is steller. I go to New Orleans frequently and have stayed at 11 different French Quarter Hotels and this one leaves them all in the dirt.

Great A well priced hotel with very friendly helpful staff. I always find hotels in Paris a bit of a gamble unless your paying top dollor. But this hotel has a nice exterior a very clean interior with helpful staff. i would stay here again.

clean and great customer service my friend and i stayed four nights and had a great time.the rooms were clean and had everthing we needed(by clean i mean checking the sheets in detail for hair or any other objects).the customer service was also great.look for mark he will happily help you with anything you need to make your stay more comfortable.

Beautiful Ritz Carlton A wonderful place to stay in San Francisco. The staff are first rate, the rooms and lobby are stunning. The room service meals were just incredible - the best steaks we have ever had. This hotel made our stay in San Francisco perfect.

The Best Having stayed at 30 Hotels in the last 90 days it takes a lot to get me enthused about a hotel at the moment but the Mandarin Oriental certainly did. I had a Harbour View room for 3 nights and the standard of the room and more importantly the standard of the service were exceptional. The gym and spa area are stunning also. It is the only hotel Ive stayed at over the last 3 months that I am keen to go and stay at again as soon as possibl

Rude people at the QT Bartender in the hotel was a jerk and used strong language towards my wife and I. After complaining to the manager, she made us feel like it was our fault for requesting a drink around midnight. Don't call the hotel for rates, shop through Hotels or something similar for best rates. Another couple traveling with us got a cheaper rate by doing so, and the manager would not match their rate. OK location, 1/2 a block from time squ. Not sure if I would ever stay there again. There are a ton of hotels and I say, look elsewher

Great gardens, and damp rooms Absolutely beautiful gardens, lovely pool area. Food in Indonesian restaurant very poor, really don't recommend you eat there. Room had a very musty smell and was damp. Bathroom small and disappointing. In summary a hotel with beautiful exterior let down by sub-standard rooms.

great hotel just got back from a 1 night stay, the location of the hotel is fantastic just at the top of Las Ramblas. Hotel itself is spotless as were the rooms. Staff at the hotel are polite. friendly and helpful. For the money you pay it can't be beaten, i would recommend it to anyone.

Diamond in the Ruff The chancelor is ideally located, seconds away from Union Square, and you can catch the trolley to take you to the trains/MUNI or just walk it, its just blocks away. The rooms are beautiful and cozy. The staff is amazingly helpful and accomadating. The weather in SF makes it unnecessary for AC, an open window was just enough for us... and we're from TX where AC is absolutely necessary!

Great anniversary night! We were able to check in early (probably as it was a slow day - the Saturday of a three day weekend) and the desk clerk, when entering our Hilton rewards card number, found out it was our 32nd anniversary. She upgraded us to a fabulour corner room, facing the harbor and gave us complimentary access to the executive suite hospitality room. The staff were all very nice, from the bell man who gave us tips on how to get into Boston and what to do once we got there, to the desk clerk, to the health club attendant, to the shuttle bus drivers. Would stay there again in a heart beat! Was only sad it was a one night stand at the end of our vacation!

I'd stay there again I spent a week at Aston Waikiki Beach Hotel in May of 2003. The service was great, the rooms were clean and decorative, I enjoyed the breakfasts set out by the pool, and the location was great. We were right across the street from Waikiki beach and within walking distance of several shops. I would definitely stay there again in the future.

Good location This is a great location but don't expect a great view from your room. The staff was pleasant but small. The mattress was very firm. It is right next to the market area which has a great place to exchange currency for no fee. It is also a good place to pick up a low priced breakfast or lunch. I would definitely stay here again.

Loved the Okura Stayed from the 26-28 oct and loved the hotel, check in was 2pm we arrived about 9.30 and was let into our room straight away. The room was large and comfortable and the bathroom was fantastic, yes it is expensive for breakfast, but when you stay in a 5* hotel what do you expect, also try out the french restaurant on the 23rd floor, very nice. would definatly stay here again and would recommend it to everyone (and im very fussy!!!)

Great Holiday Great Hotel We Stayed at the Grand Mirage Hotel from the 01/10/08-15/10/08 from start to finish the staff could not do enough for us we had a pool /sea view room excellent we had all-inclusive ,well worth paying the extra for, full marks we will be going back next year

Great location The hotel is very central and clean. However, on checking in, they told us our room was in another building across the road, which turned out to be another hotel but owned by Hotel Victoria 4. The rooms were tiny, noisey, with no natural light and a view of the hotel room opposite. Would recommend this Hotel for its location but I would insist on a room in the main building of Hotel Victoria 4.
