Four Season Mexico City Perfect way to end our week in Mexico. You can walk right past this building and never know its there. Once inside however, you know your there. I have never had the oppurtunity to stay at such a hotel, for me this was brilliant. Wonderful location on Reforma, easy ride to the airport.

Great location Clean rooms and convenient location. Close to shopping and city centre attractions. Good restaurants nearby ( down stanley st.) and friendly staff. Stayed there for 5 days. I would stay there again.

Great hotel but not for older couples Very nice hotel and efficient staff. Very modern decor which was refreshing. However, the shower/tub was very dangerous and definitely not for mature couples or persons with disabilities. There was no handle on the shower wall to assist getting in and out of the tub/shower which was quite high. Aside from this, we enjoyed our stay.

Good standard motel Stayed here at the start end end of our Northwest States tour. Good clean rooms if not a bit 'worn' and perhaps in need of a little updating. Bathrooms very small but clean and adequate. Breakfast included in price- Juice, baguels, toast cereals, and do it yourself waffles. Airport shuttle was good and left on time (runs every half hour) only a few mins from airport.

Very Convenient Comfortable Stay My husband and I have a very enjoyable stay. Everyone was very friendly and courtious. The room was very comfortable and convient to all the popular places. Walking distance to Fleet Center was great.

Good location and nice hotel The hotel is located at the Bugis Junction which is quite handy for some local cuisines. The room is good and the club floor lounge is very nice. Overall it would have been better if there is free internet access in the room as well. The hotel is within the expectation of the price we paid.

Recommend Bernini Palace I stayed in the Bernini Palace Hotel at Easter 2005. Although the lobby and first floor are recently under renovation the hotel is very, very good. Beautiful bedrooms with nice bathrooms and a great breakfast. And in the very middle of Florence. You can`t find anything better.

Simply outstanding. A great hotel with a perfect location. Staff was prompt and courteous. Room was large and very clean. Bed was like sleeping on a cloud. I honestly could not be happier with my stay and this will definitely be my first choice in the future.

Hotel The hotel has a perfect location to discover the heart of Madrid by foot! The facilities are very good for a 2 and I spent many night in 3 or 4* hotels that are not up to this standard!We booked a superior room and I can just recommend that!Anytime I would go back there!Marcel - Swiss

Friendly, Comfortable and welcoming Recently had an excellent stay in this friendly and comfortable hotel. The welcoming and efficient staff made everything go very smoothly and our room was lovely. The hotel is very handily placed for London Bridge mainline and tube and for the attractions of the southbank (Tate Modern, the Globe Theatre and Borough Market) all in easy walking distance, although it would be a good base for any visit to London. I've stayed in a number of well known central London hotels but this is the one I will return to. Very nice breakfast too!

Best location Location was absolutely superb! The best of Barcelona鈥檚 shops are just on the doorstep and do not forget to ask for shopping recommendations at reception. The room was very clean, lots of light and spacious. The black out blinds were fantastic for sleeping! We had a very enjoyable meal in the restaurant, very good value for money.

perfect for romantic getaway This is such a cool hotel, very noirish, rat pack, 50's, space-age swingin' batchelor pad kind of vibe, with funky and artsy overtones. Very romantic if you're thinking of that kind of getaway with your loved one... great views of the city. I guess it's a little off the beaten path, but if you have a car you'll be all set. Check out the Bishop Arts district which isn't too far away.

Loved it! The Grand Hyatt is a beautiful property located close to Tianamen square and the Forbidden City. It's located a floor or two above a large shopping center (handy as there are banks, drugstores and quick/cheap places to eat). We stayed on the club level which meant check in was in our room (nice touch), we had a separate concierge (albeit not speaking english as well as those in the lobby) and a delicious free breakfast and afternoon drinks. We had the grand suite - a nice bedroom with separate living/work area.

Very nice hotel This is a modern and stylish hotel in a great location in central Barcelona. The rooms are a generous size and decor leans toward minimalist and modern clean lines. The rooms are quite reasonably priced considering the surroundings, although drinks in the bar are very expensive by local standards. I'd stay here again happily.

Nice hotel, no elevator We stayed at this hotel for three nights. The staff was great - family run operation and they seemed genuinely concerned about our stay. There is no elevator and we had a room on the 3rd floor, which was a lot of steps. Breafast was included and was nice. The room itself was nice - large restroom and even a desk if you need to set up a computer.

Good find in Paris A good hotel away from the main touristy areas of Paris. Staff were very friendly, helpful and the accomodation was a fair size. Although the bathroom in my room seemed a little dated compared to others in the hotel, the whole room very clean and comfortable offering excellent value for money. Location wise, the hotel has plenty of cafes and restuarants nearby as well as some excellent patisseries. It's between two metro stops and one metro stop down from the Gare de Nord, so for getting around public transport / in and out of Paris it was ideal.

Great location This hotel was in the best location in the middle of things, but we didn't hear any noise at night. It was nice returning at the end of the day to have snacks in the bar/reception area. The rooms were clean hotel staff friendly. The breakfasts were also very good with a wide choice.

Good value, Good location Booked a two night stay including breakfast both days and evening meal on first night for 拢179.Evening meal was absolutely awful, supposedly nouveau cuisine but simply an excuse to serve minute portions of tasteless food. However everything else was great and in contrast to the evening meal, the buffet breakfast was fantastic. Room very nicely decorated, 11th floor had great panoramic view from Greenwich to Crystal Palace. The location is also good just yards from South Quay DLR station. From here you can get into central London quickly.

>No Internet access in hotel rooms !! The hotel itself is of average quality but there is no Internet access of any type in hotel rooms! The staff could be somewhat more polite and helpful (at least in opinion of someone used to European standards). If you use the shower be aware that you may get burned as the valve system is obsolete and not well maintained. The hotel is located very close to the airport, but not so easy to find as there are no road signs indicating proper direction and the hotel name is not visible from main roads.

Good place to stay in Seattle We stayed here early Sep 2008 and found the hotel to be nice. It is situated in a convenient location within walking distance of many areas of interest to visitors. Our room was clean and had all the amentities you'd expect. The roof top viewing area is great!
Breezes Was Brilliant Best Holiday Yet mexican restaura

Out of the ordinary This is an unusual hotel, different from the normal run of the mill. I had a large and comfortable room, minimalist design which actually turned out to be quite relaxing! Its a few stops on the tram from the city, the road is reasonably quiet. The tram stop is close by, as is the canal hopper service. If you like design, or want to try something different then this might be for you.

Wonderful hotel We stayed at the W for a short, romantic weekend getway. The room was awesome and location was perfect. Everything within a short walk. We had a late checkin with no problems and a very early checkout. I will stay there again!

Location, Location, Location! The location is everything with this hotel, you can even catch the train from Sydney airport and get off right opposite! The room we were originally allocated was upgraded (free of charge) due to a misunderstanding about the bed available for the third person staying with us. We booked via an internet site and were charged $AU140 per night for two nights with a $AU45 tariff for the extra person. If you don't expect 5 star service in this 4 star hotel you won't be disappointed!

Great Place! We had a wonderful time at this hotel. Great atmosphere service. The rooms are tastefuly decorated with 24 hour service. My husband needed some assistance with the internet at 2 am, and they sent someone up immediately. Room service took a while to come but other than that everything about this hotel is top notch.

great hotel! Very nice hotel located in a quite area close to the metro station. Very helpful staff and great breakfast. The rooms were elegant ant everthing clean. Located by a very nice park. Would recomend to anyone!

Felt like a queen Clean, beautifully decorated rooms. Felt as though I was the most important person there. Received excellent assistance with directions to various areas I needed to locate. Turn down service was a nice touch.

Hidden paradise in middle of the city When I make the reservation for this hotel I have no idea of the hidden paradise that I found in the middle of the city. This small hotel offers more than I expected. It has beautiful rooms with floors in marble and each bath has a jacuzzi bathtubs!! It has a enchanting patio with tropical flowers, terracota tiles and a marvlous mobiliary, a little but confortable pool and very kind personnel. Definitively I will visit this great place again.

Such elegance! I loved The Kimberly! It's small, as hotels go, but I never felt claustrophobic in it and especially not in my room. The parlor was comfortable, the kitchen surprisingly complete, and the bedroom was QUITE spacious with an awesome bed. The staff was delightful, especially the doorman, an older African American man, who was quick with a smile and never, ever gave me the feeling he was looking for a tip (which made me tip him more!).It's conveniently located to many midtown attractions and also the subway at 51st and Lexington. I would definitely stay here again, but word to the wise: make sure you get your car out of the garage within a 24 hour time period or they will charge you for an extra day, even if you're only a minute or two late!

Jury's Boston Beautiful hotel, lovely rooms, but for 拢150.00 per night they should be! Only complaint was the food. Bar food expensive and not very good. For breakfast recommend Au Bon Pain. 2 minutes walk from the the hotel and excellent and extensive and cheap menu Small friendly hotel The staff in this hotel were very friendly and helpful. The bedroom was big enough for the few days we were there. We had breakfast 3 mornings which was good value for money. Thought overall the hotel was excellent value for money in a good location and would return to this hotel if I visited Barcelona again.

Best Location in Barceloma This is possibly the best located hotel in Barcelona - right in front of the Gothic Quarter, and only 5 minutes walk to La Ramblas (just far enough away). Also, right on the harbour front which is ideal for restaurants and shopping. Room and service were excellent and highly recommended
Ci貌 che pi霉 mi ha fatto piacere... showReview(14059115, 'full');

Seriously lacking This particular Four Seasons property was absolutely forgettable. From the moment we pulled up, the service was way below expectation....sitting in the car with the luggage for several minutes (no bellhop) and having to re-circle the property to get help with the bags, to the missed wake-up call, to waiting for 45 minutes for a coctail server to approach our table in the lounge... everything seemed to be a bit off. The saving grace of this hotel (aside from the great location)would be front desk/management team. They were overall very professional and super courteous.

Great location; Comfortable hotel - shame about the building We picked the Radisson by chance out of a very long list of Boston hotels. Despite being the ugliest building in Boston it is a comfortable hotel whose location is fantastic for most of the central Boston attractions. The bed and breakfast package is good value tooRooms were comfortable and well furnished and most with great views (ask for a high floor number). The foyer and pool are dingy and in need of a bit of work

Loved the Hotel! We have just returned from a weekend at the Savoy Hotel in San Francisco. The hotel is magnificent and the staff provides excellent sevice. The rooms are quaint, and the beds are very comfortable (including egypitian cotton sheets that are very soft). They have a complimentary wine and cheese event during the late afternoon. I would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends!

Prescott - A lifesaver THe Prescott came to my aid after I left another hotel around the block which could n't provide high speed access. They set me up with a wireless bridge which worked perfectly with my laptop. I had no problem with cell phone reception in my room and probaly made 50 calls at the time. THe only reason I didn't give this lovely hotel excellent is due to the limited room service. It is difficult to find a place in the neighbourhood to get a reasonably priced meal - you don't want $30.00 entrees every night.

Avoid like the Plague Have traveled to Amsterdam over 10 times and never stayed in anywhere so TERRIBLE. The rooms were tiny (2 beds in 1 room and 3 in another). The bed was for someone aged 5 or under and the views of a concrete wall were awful. After checking out i was told i had to clean my own room which i did and then 1 week later was charged and extra 150 euros for what i don't know. I'm persuing legal action so avoid this place like the plague.

Fantastic place for the price For the second time in the span of about four weeks I'll be visiting London on business. And for the second time I booked my hotel stay at the Parkcity. As others have mentioned, the hotel is situated at a clean and relatively quiet location in Kensington. It's within a short walking distance from Hyde Park and the Natural History Museum. The staff are friendly and a pleasure to chat. I was suitably impressed with my previous stay at the Parkcity and will be so again in early July.

Perfect stay I have used the Holiday-Inn Miami-Airport West few times and every stay was perfect. Clean and new rooms, quiet, nice staff and near to the airport. Some people here write about a disco / restaurant and loud music from the 9th floor, the Holiday-Inn Miami Airport West do not have a disco and 9 floors, only 6 floors and a restaurant on the ground floor!!All the people with this bad disco and loud music experience have not stayed at the HI-Miami Airport WEST Hotel, this peoples have stayed at the HI-Miami-INTERNATIONAL Airport Hotel!

Budget This hotel is a typical budget down town Amsterdam hotel. In other words, its not for you if you are looking for something nice and cosy. It's for you who are looking for cheaper great location, walking distance to the centrum and Amsterdam Centraal station. It's not to clean and rooms are small, typical down town European. I stay there because of price and location only and only when I'm alone, would not offer it for family.
Buon confort ma si puo' trovare di meglio showReview(18009542, 'full');

4 nights at Dorsett Olympic Hotel I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We choose this hotel because it was the cheapest in town area. *Clean but small room *Slightly dirty carpet*Small TV set * Poor TV programms.*Bed is extremely hard

Very good hotel A good hotel is very important when visiting a busy city like NY. We really enjoyed our stay in the Belvedere. Nice location and very nice rooms. If you want to stay in a nice and friendly hotel you really don't want to miss this one.
Fantastic location Staff were extremely friendly. Good sized room. Excellent cooked breakfasts. Amazing location - within walking distance of most major attractions. Would definitely recommend!

Good value for New York Stayed for 6 nights from the 9th January. Had to wait till 4pm for room(official check in time 3pm)The offer of a complimentary drink or pot of tea would have been nice but not offered. Room was big by NY standards and best view over NY I've had in 6 stays in the city. Very central for all attractions and the staff helpful and efficient. Very surprised nobody has mentioned the Westway diner on 9th Avenue between 41st and 42nd street as a great place for breakfast-or for that matter any meal-they're open 24/7.

loved this hotel this hotel is a gem in London--great group of staff, who were very friendly and were sincerely attentive to all our needs. the room was clean, sleek and cool modern with great bath and fabulous toiletries. well thought out design to incorporate alot of extras. The location is block off the tube and Tower of London so easy to get around. really a great place to stay!

Great find I stayed here on my final day in Sydney prior to a long haul flight back home. Really nice hotel, with great facilities if needed. Also perfect location for access to shops in the cbd as right in the heart of the shopping area, and only a couple of minutes walk to the bars and restaurants at the harbour. Recommended.

Good hotel It is a good, clean, high end hotel in Beijing. Although I won't rate it as highly as it is hyped. Even service and concierage is not as great. The enjoyable part is good decoration, cleanliness, comfortable rooms, very clean and well designed bathrooms and location, location, location. Its walking distance from Wangfujing and subway station which is a big plus.

Functional downtown hotel Stayed for 2 nights in July 06, a functional hotel located slightly away from downtown but within 10 minutes walk of most of the sights. I'd have this down as a 3 star rather than 2.5.Received a warm welcome on arrival, and we were able to check-in despite arriving early, lots of information offered by the reception staff and secure underground parking (for $16 per day).Room was clean but not huge. The receptionist advised that the hotel was going to be refurbished later in the year, but it had cable TV, air con and everything else you need when your planning to spend most of your time exploring a fantastic city like Seattle. Had breakfast in the hotel restaurant on the first day but it was over-priced and the food wasn't great. On the second day we chose to go to one of the many local coffee shops, which was much better and cheaper!
Anniversary Spot Absolutely beautiful. Awesome location. Nice food. Service is good. Room size is little small. I would recommend it for a romantic getaway.

Best in London This is the BEST bargain in London!! Room faced the street and we had no problem with noise, breakfeast was included and good.......vey friendly staff. will not stay anywhere else when in London.

w favorite hotel in theatre district I found this hotel perfect for my needs--good area, large enough room, clean, friendly staff, not ridiculously expensive. I even had a view--which is not often the case in less expensive New York Hotels. I booked an Executive double double and it was nicely renovated, and felt fresh. Perfect for going to plays, taking the subway , and finding good resturants close by.
So o o o Good!! Smalle cafe/bar Jordaan. It's Dutch, it's good!!

Great value Spent one night at this hotel and thought it was excellent. All was really clean, staff friendly and efficient . I arrived expecting to share bathroom but found to my surprise all was ensuite! A lucky break.. Location is really good - within walking distance of Gare St Lazare and Gare du Nord and easy to reach from metro. Would definitely stay there again.

Great hotel Fantastic hotel as you will have seen from the other reviews. Nice touches like the teddy bear by the bed and the duck by the bath. Very central for business travellers and there is an MTR station below the hotel in Pacific Place, a massive shopping centre but not cheap!The only slightly negative thing I could say about the hotel is to do with the swimming pool location. The hotel is next to the Shangri-la hotel and in the afternoon the Shangri-la blocks the sun from the pool. Other than that the place is faultless.

Fabulous hotel!! Service - view - location - pool! The Adlon is rated as one of the top 5 hotels in Europe, and with good reason! The site is gorgeous, incredibly convenient to historical sites, and has an amazing view of the recently refurbished Brandenburg Gate. The rooms are tremendous, service is outstanding, and the pool is a decadent Greco-Roman paradise in the middle of Berlin! I couldn't recommend this hotel highly enough!

Cool I found the W Seattle to be as advertized - trendy, pricey and spectacular. The rooms are more spacious than other W's I've stayed at and the service was impeccable. The views of Puget Sound and downtown were nothing short of breathtaking. If you don't mind spending a bit more, the W is for you.

Efficient and well run OK it will not win prizes for personality but the rooms are a good size in a great location with comfortable beds - what more do you need?A few tips breakfast is very expensive but if your happy to pay 22 euro each its a good spread but I would advise you to try some of the nearby cafes more BerlinI upgraded to one of the suites it was only a small addition to the price but well worth it and dont be put off by courtyard view rooms they are fine .

Nice property and great location We stayed at the Embassy Suites Scottsdale 3/25-27, 05. A very nice property with great views of the golf course and mountains. Hotel is close to Paradise Valley mall and lots of restaurant. Good breakfast and courteous staff.

Will not stay here again! While traveling down the PCH from Bellingham, WA to San Diego, CA we made reservations for and stayed at the Seattle Quality Inn Suites. Yes, the hotel was within walking distance of the Space Needle. However, when I requested a 2pm check-out (we did not check-in until after 7pm) as per the special services extended to Choice Privileges members, I was told the latest we could check-out was 1pm; the room was small; there was an accumulation on dust on the top of the drapes which fell down on me when I pulled them closed; only one elevator worked and it was slow; the complimentary in room coffee service was provide only for one person; after showering, the bathtub took forever to drain (over 8 minutes) and left behind scum; we had to walk through the indoor pool area to reach the breakfast room; the business center computer was out of order; and the sole desk clerk was so harried trying to do several tasks at once that several guests left after waiting too long for service.

Top Marks Top marks for this special boutique hotel, we loved it! The atmosphere is warm and really welcoming, all the staff very helpful. Comfortable room (fantastic marble bathroom) and superb view! Breakfast was excellent. Pity we weren't there in the warmer season when it's served in the courtyard (which looks delightful). We couldn't have wished for more and will certainly be back!

Fantastic hotel We can't praise this hotel enough! Well located in the Mitte (former East Berlin) district, close to U-Bahn and tram lines. Hotel and bar staff were extremely helpful and spoke excellent English. The hotel offers a brilliant full buffet breakfast and free internet access in the front bar. The hotel is funky and hip, with a great decor. Will definitely stay here again!
Love the Hotel Rex We enjoyed the Hotel Rex! Great location. Ambience is charming. Very Friendly and helpful staff. Great weekend trip
should be a 2 * Who ever said this hotel should be a 5 * is crazzzzzy. This place sucks!!!!! I can t even say you get what you pay for because this was the most i ever payed for a trip.

Excellent Apartments The apartments and overall facilities exceeded our expectations. For a very reasonable price we got a new, well appointed apartment that was quiet, secure and extremely clean. The location was not like being in the heart of Sydney but there were some good eating places close by and it was not far by taxi to Sydney center. We would certainly stay at the Meriton again in the future.

Good value hotel Very good value - we got a deal on Expedia and were pleasantly suprised by the hotel. It was very clean and comfortable and very centrally based in the main shopping district. The main tourist attractions are based in the Mitte; however these are easily reached by the U-Bahn or by the S Line from the nearby Zoo Bahnhoff. Good amenities and nightlife nearby and I would be happy to stay here again the next time I go to Berli

dreams was a dream Our family of 4(2 adults, 2 kids) had an excellent vacation experience. The Dreams hotel was very clean and the staff was very accomodating. There was a lot of games and activities that were fun and suitable for kids and adults of all ages. The entertainment staff put on great shows every evening. The hotel also offered 8 different restaurants with good food and service.

xcellent hotel Returned yesterday from a few days at this hotel. The staff are very friendly and the rooms are kept spotless. The food and drink on offer are both good value and of a good standard. The hotel is fairly central with a metro station outside the front door. A good choice hotel for anyone who likes quality at an affordable price.

Great place to stay Stopped for three days on the way to NZ, and enjoyed immensely. Room pretty good although can get a bit noisy outside, saying that my 5 year old slept perfectly. The reason for 5 is partly for location but mainly for the excellent staff, for example we arrived and I had lost the suitcase keys. the desk guy managed to find a saw and had freed up our possesions before I returned with (superb) coffees from opposite 7-11. Nothing seems to be too much trouble. Will certainly stay again on next trip over to NZ

super time, gorgeous place put simply, I loved this place. It was a nice little hideaway on a great shopping street. It was so pretty and quiet, the staff always smiling and happy to help. I must have called them for rides 10 times while I was there and it was never a problem. I also loved their pumpkin soup and lime juice. I hope to go back again, this time for my honeymoon.

hristmas In New York The city is very busy during Christmas, but we had a very good time. The Mariott Marquis is the place to stay if you can afford it. You can walk to all of the popular shows and we felt safe on the streets. We were in a group of 8 and we all had a wonderful time.

Superb hotel, great staff, fab location Just returned from a 3 night stay in Barcelona with my mum. Booked this hotel after reading good reviews on this website and it did not disappoint. The location is fantastic, lots of great sights within walking distance and no matter where we wanted to go, it cost us less than 5 euro's in a taxi. The staff were very friendly and took time to point us in the right direction for the sights we wanted to visit and also recommended and booked restaurants for us free of charge. Our room was very comfortable, they remembered to not give me feather pillows and the free minibar was a lovely touch. Cannot praise them enough.

Downtown luxury... My fiance and I stayed at the Wyndahm for 3 days! The rooms were incredible! The staff there is nothing short of incredible. I must say that because they were packed for the holiday weekend, but still took the time to handle each patron with whatever they needed!

Superb Hotel We are going to The Swissotel again in November this year, it will be the third year we have stayed there. The business lounge is wonderful value and perfect for a quiet evening in to just relax after a busy day. Would not stay anywhere else in Berlin. The staff are all great.

Great Location! For those who've never been to San Francisco, The Tuscan Inn (near Fisherman's Wharf) is the perfect first. We were near all the transportation modes (and there are plenty), shopping, entertainment, and restaurants. Our room was large and comfortable, and the staff was top-notch (especially Elmer). If you have a question, they have the answer or will get it for you. We were very pleased with The Tuscan Inn.

return visit to New Orleans O.K. for the budget vacationer on foot. $47.99 a night, Dec. 18-20. Breakfast is sweet rolls coffee. No juice, tea, or hot chocolate. Not handy if you don't already know your way around Canal St. the French Quarter.

Excellent Good experience and will return. I upgraded to business floor and had a wonderful room and access to wireless and a printer. The Equinoc restaurant had good food and a super view. Check in was easy and staff was accommodating. Close to number of good restaurants.

Rude and disorganized staff Arrived from a very long flight with my husband and 3 yr old toddler. The initial receptionist was very pleasant and checked us in without any problems as everything was in order with the room number already printed on the reservation slip at the front desk. After settling in and resting for about 2 hrs, we received a shock of our lives when someone tried to open the front door of our apartment but failed then we got a call from the front desk. The Manager (some guy) had the gull to ask us to move out to another room as the room is meant reserved for someone else and said the earlier staff that checked us in was new. So what if old or new staff, this is not the way to treat guests and not even an apology was given for their mistake! I will NEVER recommend this place to anyone!

Great location, fun district and nearby a major subway/train station We usually stay at the Peninsula when in Tokyo for business, but a Japanese colleague recommened the Cerulean. The location was great, walking distance to the side-streets of Shibuya and the Shibuya train station which has connections to many of the major tourist sights. The hotel itself was adequate and clean. Service was good, but still not compable to five star hotels like the Peninsula or Four Seasons. A friend mentioned the Italian restaurant there was good, but we didn't have the chance to try it.

Not a bad word to say about it!! Excellent location - literally 2 minute walk to La Ramblas. Staff are extremely helpful and freindly. Rooms are on the basic side, but they have everything that you'd need. I'd definately stay there again..

Unfair Due to loss of my credit card on holiday, I could not show the card used for payment of the room. The staff were very unhelpful, and proceeded to charge for the room but refused to let us stay despite proof of ID. Waste of 拢73. We had to make our way to the airpost and stay there for the evening as it was too late to go anywhere else.

Not recommended The room was disappointing. The furniture was very scuffed, and the walls had some stains. The staff was somewhat friendly, but more better looking than actually helpful. The exception was the valets, who were consistently doing a great job. For the money, better accomodation can be found in Seattle.

Excellent location This is a great hotel considering the rate, location and level of service. We had a great stay of 5 days - so close to best part of the city and major attractions! Rooms were adeqate and well decorated with clean and modern bathrooms. Only negative was heating which was not adequate. We will stay there again.

Excellent value for money We stayed in this hotel from 29th Dec to 1st January. The hotel is small and the staff are very friendly. The room we stayed in was larger than we expected and was extremely clean and comfortable. As other people have stated, the hotel is in a quiet location but is in easy walking distance to other livelier areas of the city. It is also a short walk to the nearest metro station. Considering what some of the other hotels were charging in Paris, I would consider this hotel to be excellent value for money.

A great hotel! This is a beautiful hotel with wonderful service, and it is within walking distance of most attractions (we timed our selves strolling to the Duomo and it took about 6 minutes). I know that many times the star ratings on travel websites do not have any basis in realiity, however, this time I completely agree with the rating on Expedia.com that it is four star hotel. The rooms were great, the breakfasts were very nice, and I loved that the shower products are from the famed nuns at the Perfumia Santa Maria Novella. We stayed in Florence for a week and had a wonderful time. If you would like to know anything else about this hotel, or places to eat in Florence, please feel free to email me at foodiedb@optonline.net.

Fantastic Our company used the Michelangelo Hotel for a business meeting with 16 participants. The hotel was fantastic, from the absolutely wonderful rooms to the service, and the great European feel. The staff was helpful, friendly and the meeting staff was available non-stop. They do not have a business office per se, however, they were willing to make copies for us in their offices, and Kinko's is a couple of blocks away. Definitely a great experience.
Great Hotel I had an great weekend in the Berlin Plaza Hotel. The Service is excellent, and you feel always to be welcomed. I would stay the next time always in the Berlin Plaza Hotel.

Great Customer Service I found this hotel to be very stylish and clean, supported by great customer service. We had a slight problem during our stay(water temp) and it was resolved withing minutes and our nightly rate was reduced. This hotel is perfect walking distance to pike place and all of the shopping in downtown Seattle. I would definately stay here again.

We really liked it!! We really enjoyed Le Meridien - friendly staff, very nice room (great bathtub and bed) very good location, nice view. It was really one of the best hotels I've ever stayed in. Highly recommended. We got it through priceline for $115 + tax.

perfect hotel four of us traveled to paris and staying at the du cadran was an ideal location..within walking distance to all attractions..a market area is around the corner(rue cler)..cafes and shops everywhere...and the other end of the block is a pastry shop( don't pass it up)..enjoy the tarts..complimentary breakfast was very good.. bagettes,croissants.coffe,juice.cereal and fruits.. great way to start the day..rooms are typical,,small but very clean.. we would stay there again..

Love the A-Train Stayed for a week in the loft apartment with four of us. Love the A-Train. Friendly staff, clean rooms and hotel - great breakfast included every morning. The price was more than reasonable. The location was also great, right across from the train station, but somehow not in the heart of all the chaos. Going back to Amsterdam again and already have my reservation at the A-Train.

Lovely hotel I stayed at the Adolphus for 3 days in April 2007. I was impressed with the hotel overall. Many hotels claim to be 'historic' but really thats just a cover up for being a bit old and lacking in services, not so with the Adolphus!The Adolphus was great, room was big, and good value for money considering its location and the standard of the furnishings. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly.

Excellent Service Spot. If you need a comfortable place to crash after a hectic day of sightseeing, this is the place. Hospitality is the word here-starting with Amie the person responsible for checking us in. Amazing how close we were to the major sights. We walked to all of them.

Great little hotel We really enjoyed our stay at the Luna and Simone! The staff was friendly, the room was small but cute, cozy and clean and the perfect amount of space for the two of us, the breakfast was delicious and an awesome start to the day:) The hotel is within walking distance to everything and if you don't want to walk the bus stops right outside the door or Victoria tube station is just a bit of a walk up the road! We would definitely go back and highly recommend for anyone travelling to London!

gotta love the gym Other reviews have covered the room, the food etc. I want to add that the hilton has the best health club I have come across on my business trips. The latest in exercise machines, good selection of free weights and best of all, access to group fitness classes. This alone makes this hotel worth a return visit.

Very Nice Hotel Recently my wife and I stayed at the Hyatt for 4 nights. The hotel was very nice with exzcellent service . The hotel staff could not do enough for you. The sports bar has decent food and is a great place to watch a sporting event.

>Caveat on 'Ocean View' Room We booked an ocean view room in the Rainbow Tower. There was a nice view of the harbor, but the only way you could actually see the ocean from our room would be to step out onto the balcony and lean over to see a small sliver of Pacific. I complained that this did not constitute an ocean view in my mind, but the hotel staff told me that is how the room is classified, and refused to move us. Other then this disappointment, the hotel was great.

great location loved the fittings and the design; great use of available space. people at desk couldn't have been nicer. great location, right by museums. breakfast not up to the rest, but that's a small quibble. i look forward to other roommate stays.

Fantastic Hotel We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Apex. The rooms were spotless and larger than the average London hotel. Staff were very friendly and the food was delicious. I am already looking forward to returning.

Great hotel in a very convenient location I really enjoyed my stay at the Abba Sants hotel. It is very comfortable, modern hotel. It's location, a few minutes walk from the Sants train station, is very convenient for travelers who are visiting the city. The hotel staff was great about giving restaurant recommendations that locals actually go to. The only downside was that the rooms were uncomfortably warm and the only way to cool down was to open the window which unfortunately let in the noise from a very busy street.
The standard It was so beautiful I actually cried when we left... Very expensive, but for the once-in-a-lifetime trip (honeymoon), it is worth it. We're ruined for other hotels forever ;)

Loved It... We got an excellent rate online which included breakfast (a must!) We could not have been more pleased with the hotel and staff. The rooms and hallways are a bit dated, but they are spotless and have many amenities. Special compliments to both the reception and housekeeping staff which made the difference in our rating the hotel a 5 rather than 4.

lovely, just what you need if you are looking to stay somewhere pleasant but not too posh then this place is in a great location and not badly priced. we asked for a room with a view over the canal and it had great large windows for us to look out of.brekkie was nice and the bar at the front of the hotel was a nice atmosphere. For most people going to amsterdam, this place would be entirely suitable and in a great location. (quiet, just off rembrantsplain) if your looking for a plush pad, then go somewhere else.

Good Value and Location Spent 3 nights ($110 per night) at the Ilima in Dec 2005. Very happy with the proximity to Waikiki Beach and the surrounding designer boutiques (Gucci, Chanel, Prada, etc.) and restaurants. This is not a 4 or 5 star establishment, but that is OK, since you are not paying prime $$$. The rooms are outdated, but clean, comfortable, and roomy. We found the staff to be friendly. If you are looking to save money and be within walking distance to all the action on Waikiki, then stay at the Ilima.

Very comfortable and clean hotel with a great breakfast buffet We arrived direct from the airport and recieved excellent service from the very start. The twin room we had was very spacious and had a very useful small kitchenette, with microwave, dishwasher and small stoveThe breakfast buffet was very busy with a long que, but worth the wait and had a good selection. Location is good, with many of the Boston tours stopping just outside. USS Constallation is within walking distanceI would stay at this hotel agai

Great Place to Destress..... Just returned from 3 nights at the Maya Ubud which was absolute heaven. We stayed in the superior garden villa - and the only sound to be heard was the birds and the occasional thwack of a tennis ball. The Spa is situated in a great location and the elevator ride down to reach the infinity pool and facilities is a great way to avoid the steps! We both had the 75 minute massages and it was so tranquil to only hear the sound of the river flowing below and the odd frog!The amenities around the hotel were excellent and we ate in most of the restaurants and found the service and food to be fantastic. We also did the nature walk with a guide and enjoyed going through the villages and walking through a rice paddy. All in all a great place to stay if you want to have peace and quiet but be close to main centre (5/8 minutes away)

Perfect location This is a great little hotel in the most romantic spot right on the canal. Yes, difficult to find on first arriving, but that's the only thing I'd say to watch out for. The location was perfect, right in the centre of things but not so close that noise is a problem. The room was lovely and so were the staff. I think this is great value for money.

A comfortable stay My wife and I stayed here when we were up for a Red Sox game. Our stay was very nice and everything in the hotel is excellent quality. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was spacious. There were some nice views in the hotel but the one from our room was not great.
Ein Wochenende i m Arcotel Velvet Berlin showReview(11377627, 'full');

Great Location, Great Staff We stayed a week at the JW. Perfect location- walked to restaurants, aquarium, casino. Staff was wonderful-especially Gwendalyn. Room was good size, free washer/dryer on 8th floor, housekeeping and turndown were great. Hotel was busy, but still able to offer personal service.
Great Hotel We spent two wonderful nights at the San Juan Marriott Resort in Condado. The service was excellent and the food very good. We would most definitely stay here again.

Best hotel in in Oahu We had a fantastic holiday in the Hawaiian Prince last month. The staff were very helpful and friendly and I would like to give a special mention to Brenda who made our stay very special for my husband 50th birthday (upgraded us to a beautiful room with a fantastic view) . Also a special mention to Linda who worked in the pool area and was always helpful and attentive. If we every come back we will definitely stay in the Hawaiian Prince hotel.

Perfect for Hollywood Excellent location, just a couple of minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and within easy reach of other great attractions. Short Drive to Universal Studios. Accommodation was very good. We didn't cater for ourselves as good restaurants and coffee shops close by. But the facilities were good enough had we have wanted to.

A fabulous jewel A fabulous boutique hotel in a neighborhood with spectacular views of the city.... we came for my 50th birthday and were upgraded to a city suite that was more memorable and charming than that of my honeymoon. We actually cancelled another reservation on our way back from Monterey Peninsula to stay here again.

A hidden gem in the center of Manhattan We love small European hotels and rarely see anything similar in the United States. We could have sworn we were in Paris but we were in the middle of New York. The hotel oozes charm, the breakfast is incredible, the stafff very friendly and helpful and the price is right!

Shabby is definitely the word Checked into the Sheraton and asked specifically for a room NOT overlooking the construction. Got a room overlooking just that. Ripped curtains, dirty carpet (from construction dust). This property is not run by Sheraton, just under their umbrella. For the price charged, I would NOT recommend staying there. Perhaps Sheraton should review some of the hotels they license to outside owners.

Disappointing Given the reviews I read about the Oberoi and the reputation of the chain, I expected excellent and consistent service. We were surprised at the lack of consistency of the service and had a bad experience with the staff's confusion regarding whether breakfast was included in our rate. The management is clearly not doing its job in ensuring consistency and communication amongst the staff. The grounds, however, are beautiful and the location is lovely, however I think there are better value for money options in Bali.

ral location with friendly atmosphere. We stayed here early October and even though we had done our homework on location, were pleasantly pleased with the hotels location. In the heart of the city, just a few steps away from Chinatown and easy access to the two cable car lines or street cars, to give you quick tranportation to the main attraction areas. Ok there is street noise but then again you are in the centre of a city and the lift can be heard but not enough to disturb you. Our room was on the ninth floor and the view from the window overlooking the roof tops was lovely, the bathroom was very modern, and it was handy to have a safe deposit box in you room at no extra charge. We found the hotel recepitionists all to be very helpful.

Not what I expected unfortunately. After booking in for business travel I was given a small rooom with barely enough space to walk around the queen size bed. Not very luxurious with regular TV etc (no flat sceen), and no view from the 6th floor. I requested a better room and was given a room on the top floor right next to the elevators, which were noisy and disturbed my sleep. After requesting a room change again I was given another average room by front desk staff who seem reluctant to help. As far as deluxe hotels go this place is really quite average - I think there are many better 5* hotels out there.

Great value Hard to imagine better value for the money. The room was clean, the location great, the staff courteous (although sometimes a bit flustered). If you want great value, stay here. If you want a hotel where the staff grovel at your feet and lick your boots, then stay somewhere else and pay much more. A note for critics of the staff ...a few thoughtful words in French will pay substantial dividends in terms of service.

Recommended Hotel In Hong Kong Nice hotel on the Kowloon side of Hong Kong (I typically prefer Hong Kong Island side as its closer to my favorite shopping areas and cool neighborhoods like SoHo). I'm definitely a fan of the Shangri-La chain of hotels. The service is always fantastic and you get a feel for the Asian culture. The rooms are very nice, spacious, and well decorated. The lodging was very reasonable when I stayed there - around $200USD/night - more than worth it!

Loved it! The hotel is in a up and coming area of Berlin, where people are on the go 24/7 - its great for nightlife. The staff were friendly and provided an excellent service. The room was clean, a good size, and there were all amenities needed and more - including a kitchen area. I was surprised by the quality of this hotel for it price, and would reccomend it to anyone!

A wonderful stay at the London Bridge Last weekend my partner and I went to London for a break and also got married. (just the two of us and a couple of witnesses)We booked into the London Bridge the day before we were due to get married and found that kindly they had upgraded us to a luxury room with a super king bed, champagne, fruit and chocolates, what a lovely surprise!Everything else about the London Bridge was excellent too, clean, comfortable, delicious breakfast and friendly staff. We will definitley be returning again on our next trip to London.

Good Hotel My husband and I stayed at Plaza Lucchesi Hotel for 2 nights while in Florence. It was a good hotel but the location was a bit out of the way, it's not in the heart of the city and you either have to walk a bit or take a taxi to get anywhere. But its right on the river and restaurant is very good!

Best hotel in Amsterdam This hotel is a personal favourite of mine. An Amsterdam townhouse on a quiet side canal, yet within walking distance of just about anything you want to see (and convenient for Anne Frank's house in particular). The rooms are HUGE, well appointed, with clean bathrooms, fridge, TV, buffet breakfast and friendly staff. It's the only place I would stay in Amsterdam. Try for a room on the canal side.

ice hotel We had a beautiful room, very big, with a comfortable bed and a huge bathroom, But this is an old hotel, dated. I found it not very clean, the carpets were dirty and also the restaurant was like that (and food was not so good...). I didn't like all that cement, gray walls. Anyway, people working there were nice, we arrived late at night but they allowed us to have dinner even if the restaurant was already closed, and they gave us a lot of information: very nice and polite. I think it is a good hotel if you have children (the pool is very big), but it is too much expensive for the quality of the building.

Perfect location, Lovely hotel! We had a wonderful time in Florence, and the hotel was part of that experience. The location was perfect for sightseeing, perfect for that quick nap or package drop off. It was clean and lovely, the people at the desk were very helpful. I would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Recommend this Hotel Have just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel and we would highly recommend it. The rooms are fine and spotless, the breakfast is great but what really makes the hotel is their fantastic staff who are friendly and willing to give good recommedations for restarants etc. The location is also good, very central and we had 3 rooms in different parts of the hotel and none of us suffered from any of the noise referred to in earlier reviews. - despite us being 40ish year old women.

Remove the NIne and what you have is zero!!!! I have spent a lot of time in nice boutique hotels, and nine zero may have been the worst hotel I've ever been to. From the minute i checked in with the snippy kid at the fornt desk to the fifty-five minute wait for room service everything was terrible!!

Loved the Chancellor I was very pleased with my stay here. The room was very comfortable and very clean. The location is perfect. Staff very friendly and helpful. I would stay at this hotel again and would certainly recommend it.
Fue una maravilla!!!!! sergi y berta de vilanova i la geltru(barcelona) showReview(8505188, 'full');

ice place I was at The Mango for a week an it is a charming little place, with very nice people and cozy. Very close to the beach and to restaurants. Close to everything you need on vacation without the big price.

Fantastic! Our family stayed here for a wedding and had an absolutely wonderful time. We occupied 5 rooms and after the first day the staff knew us helped us with all kinds of things. The rooms were delightful and we loved the evening wine tasting. I especially liked the bellman that looks like Mel Gibson!

Helpful and friendly staff Comfortable well furnished rooms and one of the quietest hotel rooms I have stayed in. Front desk staff were friendly and helpful as were the bar and restaurant staff. The two front door men were exceptional, always happy and helpful even in the dreadful weather Boston experienced during the whole 4 days. A well run hotel with pleasant helpful staff, a lot of whom have worked at the hotel for many years - always the sign of a good hotel. Boston is not one of my favourite city's but the Langham made it enjoyable.

Wonderful Visited for 3 days in March 2006 for our sons 21st birthday, What a great City and an even greater hotel !! We looked on Trip Advisor prior to going and the Savoy was highly recommended, we were not disappointed. Situated in the Plazza Della Republica with great views this is a beautiful hotel with great rooms great restaurants and some of the best trained staff we have ever come across, the service was second to none and the manager should be proud of him/herself. The location is great with all the attractions of Florence within easy walking distance. Our rooms were at the front directly overlooking the Plzza Della Republica, it was amazing , we could look out and listen to music playing every night, from violins, to salsa, opera and the atmosphere was electric - Cant wait to go back !!!!

love the pacific beach stayed oct.14-21.were upgraded to a oceanfront room.this is our second stay at the pacific beach.we will go back next Oct.after having the ocean front room I'm spoilt.the room was very clean,also the maids were very helpful,cleaning our room when we went down to breakfast.they also have a great beauty shop in the hotel.my only fault was the Neptune restaurant,the breakfast was great but the evening meal was terribly overpriced,and not that good.overall we have few if any complaints,cant wait to go back.

the best This hotel was fab so big never been to a resort were you had to get a lift to the beach Food excellent rooms clean and tidy maid was a bit hit and miss with towels but not a problem beach was very nice and clean plenty of entertainment regardless of what you liked Weather was very hot when it was not raining and that only lasted a couple of minutes

Is that Rooms? I was one day at Kowloon Hotel, but I am wondering is it possibile to call that room an hotel room. I was alone and even if I am not too fat, the space was exactly for me. Ok, room in HKG are very small but this seems too small, otherwise concierge service was good and location is ok for Kowloon nad Nathan Road.considering all and what i have paied I can say this hotel is on everage quality and I will return only If I could be able to find a very... very... good price... otherwise not!!!

better for pleasure than business As lovely as other kimptons in terms of quality of finish amenities. Very servicable fitness area, in-room desks with wired net, cute nautical touches. Right smack in the heart of the tourist waterfront. I would come back with my spouse for vacation or if you're a business person dragging family then this would be a great fit. Some of the rooms are quite spacious and would be good for families. As a straight business traveler it was a distracting location, with a low noise level that I'd roll with if I were vacationing too but was hard to not feel curmudgeonly when I had 7:30 am meetings.

A Real Gem I took my son to Fenway for his birthday and we stayed as a treat at The Eliot and had dinner the after the game at Uni, the sashimi bar off the lobby of the hotel where my son spotted Jim Brady. Boy, was my kid excited: the brand new, suites were unbelievably beautiful, with luxury amenities and very kind service. We were all very impressed with our stay and can't wait to do the same next year. It mad our Boston experience very special.

Nice Stay We stayed for 3 nights in the hotel and can recommend it if you want to explore madrid without spending too much money for the hotel. The hotel was very clean and the staff friendly and helpful. If you do not want to pay hat much for the breakfast, you can go in one of the small cafes not that far from the hotel and enjoy the superp spanish coffee. An underground station is directly in front of the hotel, whith which you can easily go to the city center.

>Sold me out. Well, we never actually stood at this hotel. We did have a reservation, but did not stay. The one bedroom suite we reserved was not available and the standard room that manager offered us to crash in (it was about 11pm as we arrived) was so dirty and filthy that we just left.

Fabulous! We stayed here for 4 nights and loved every moment. We were lucky enough to get an upgrade so had the benefit of a high room with superb views. The location of the hotel was excellent and the staff very helpful. Would recommend this hotel to couples who like to be close to all the shops, bars and restaurants. Try out the revolving restaurant 'The View' in the Marriott Marquis, Times Square, fab views and the foods good too!

Good Stay We stayed at the Cathedral before leaving MexicoEverything was fine except the pillows a bit hardBreakfast was good and the limousine that took us to the airport was immaculate and only cost us $12 The room cost was 432pesos (cash) no complaints at this one, would definetly stay agai

recommended by a friend We stopped in Hawaii on our way to and from Australia Dec 2007-Jan 2008. A friend had recommended the Queen based on a stay from several years before. Although older, the hotel provided a clean and comfortable place to stay for our visit -- a one-night stay going over and several nights coming back from Australia. We were able to get to all of the places we wanted to visit around Honolulu while we were there. The beach was within easy walking distance.

value for money I stayed for 5 nights in the hotel , i must say it is value for money. it is very near to all amnesties, and city centre. the manger and his wife were very freindly. rooms anre clean and linen changed every day. i had superkiing size bed for single occupancy. overall impression is good apart from the neighbiurhood which is bit rough, but no troubl

Loved it! There is absolutely nothing I can bad about this hotel. Loved the room. Staff was great. We ate in the restaurant and ordered room service, both of which was great. It was also in a great location and was a cheap cab ride to and from the bars.

Nice place to stay! Only stayed one night but were treated with the utmost courtesy and friendliness by the staff. Quiet(and not over-heated!!) well decorated room which though smallish was well equipped. Would have no hesitation in going back.

Above average, good value Spent 2 nights at the Eastgate Tower, in mid-town Manhattan. It is well located, close enough to Grand Central Station to catch the trains, a healthy but do-able walk to Broadway Theatres, and there's a decent bagel place (Daniel's) a couple of blocks away. The room (2 beds) was large, with a kitchenette, which is very convenient for storing and heating up food (there's an oven/range+ microwave, sink and fridge, with dishes and utensils provided). Maid service included dish-washing. TV was an older CRT model.

Great small hotel Spent a week at the Hotel de londres eiffel. English speaking staff. Clean rooms but small. No restaurant but plenty others close at hand. If you are not looking for luxury and want to experience the local atmosphere I would recommend this hotel. A bonus is that it is 3 blocks from the Eiffel Tower.

Efficient, patient, friendly I stayed at the Savoy for a shopping weekend in Berlin and found it a superb elegant hotel. The lobby and the restaurant simply invite to sit down and relax. The room we stayed in was huge, clean and utterly comfortable. I have to mention the staff of the front desk and in the restaurant are efficient, fast, patient and friendly. Each of our requests were taken care of immediately. Will be back soon.

Just like they said... The Jazz was just as I had expected it to be. The hotel was nice to look at, there was a rumble from the underground, the rooms were clean and looked as they did in pictures, and it truly is very close to La Ramblas. All in all, for a three-star hotel it was great -- certainly great value for the money.

Loved it! We stayed here in June 2007 and had a wonderful experience. Perfect location with a beautiful terrace overlooking the quiet San Martin plaza. Clean, comfortable, spacious rooms with friendly bilingual staff. Awesome buffet breakfast that is available until noon.

Loved the JW We recently stayed a week here Oct 13-19 and had a wonderful time. We were here for an anniversary and a birthday. The location is excellent and the beds are heavenly! Because there are so many restaurants to try we only ate breakfast in the hotel, the restaurant Shulas was very attractive and breakfast was quite good.

Large and Comfortable Room Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Sofitel. The rooms are very large for NY and very well appointed and comfortable. The ambiance is French, which also adds to the charm. Had an excellent dinner two doors down at DB Bistro Moderne. Also recommend that you stop by the Royalton across the street to visit its wonderful bar.

Perfect!!! Just everything you need: perfect room, friendly staff, bathroabs and sleepers in your room, nice linen and very comfortable beds. And yes, it's a very quiet place. Would certainly stay there again.

Overall good For the price and location you can't do better. The staff is very friendly, you are 30 seconds away from the beach on foot, and 30 seconds away from buses to the airport or old San Juan. Isla Verde (where the hotel is) is a safe touristy place but, of course, old San Juan is far more picturesque -- and far more expensive... Make sure to eat at PLATOS, the hotel's restaurant: some of the best food I had in Puerto Rico and, again, very reasonably priced.

Great Location From the time I arrived at the front door until I left, the staff made you fell welcome. The breakfast is very good, but having dinner at the hotel is a little expensive. Lots of eaterys close by. Wynyard Station is the very close to the hotel. Walk through Hunter Connection and your are basically on the hotel.

Fantastic!! Stayed here from May 16-23. The hotel is ideally located in the Fashion District of the city and all the shopping you can imagine in only minutes away. The doormen are exceptionally friendly and hospitable, and are extremely knowledgable regading tourist must-sees. The California room was wonderful; with a huge bathroom which included a shower and soaking tub. Can't wait to go back, a truly pleasant experience.

good room with good breakfast we had a job in the nebhourhood. our crewmen and me stay there for week . room were clean everyday well done . our worker enjoy hot tub after hard working day. They loved free hot waffle and other stuff.best thing is they have free parking for big truck .love to tell other contractor to stay that place.

Some Trick photography in the advertising The main saving graces of this hotel are the helpful and friendly staff and the fact the windows open to let the smell out!! I burst out laughing when I saw the gym, it is a converted closet and is so small the treadmill has to be put on an angle to fit. I've had two broken TV sets in a row (Maybe a rock band stayed there before me).

Will be returning to the Alba Hotel in Florence We thoroughly enjoyed every minute spent in Florence and Alba Hotel contributed to our fantastic time! Located on Via Della Scala, it was the perfect location, central to everything Florence has to offer. The staff were very polite, breakfast was the perfect start to each day and the rooms were beautiful! We will be returning to Florence and will definitely be staying at Alba Hotel again!

great experience Just returned from a group program. Overall, we had a great time.. Rooms were excellent, service friendly, pools beautiful. Food was average and can be improved for a 5 star resort. The staff was delightful and all of us (60 people) had a great experience.

Spot On Not one to write these types of reviews generally but would liketo leave a few comments on the Hotel D'Albe ( Rue De La Harpe ) as accommodation in city centres can often be hit and miss. Went with my wife and my parents for short break via Eurostar to celebrate my mother's 70th birthday and can only say experience was superb. Staff were very helpful with all travel ,restaurant and river cruise bookings - as said location ideal,premises were very clean and would definitely recommend to any friends/family in the future.

Nice place for limited budget My experience with this place was very positive. The room was small but clean and comfortable. The location is excellent, close to several major tourist spots and close to public transportation (5-10 mins walk to underground stations and a bus stop (24) right in front of the hotel). For anyone who does not want to spend a fortune staying in London, I strongly recommend this place.

Great find in a beautiful city Stayed at this gem of a place over the christmas weekend and really enjoyed it. The location was very good, in the Southern Canal Belt which was close enough to all the major attractions without feeling too touristy, and the tram links were frequent and convenient. After reading the previous reviews was actually prepared for a small closet room but the bedroom was pleasantly spacious and definitely one of the bigger ones I've seen in Europe. The complimentary minibar was a nice finishing touch, and the Living Room reception area, with a cheery fire and free flow of drinks and snacks, was a lifesaver for those cold Amsterdam afternoons.. All in all, a great place and would not hesitate in recommending to any

Magnificent Oasis of peace in the middle of the bustle of Mongkok. Superb hotel with all the expected facilities at a good value price. Our 25th floor Executive Room was spacious, clean comfortable. Excellent service throughout. We have never had as stress free an arrival in a new city as we did in Hong Kong, having booked the transfer from the airport to the hotel. Good location close to subway, making easy connections to all parts of the city.

Great Location Great location, would recommend this hotel for a city break! Just off the Placa Catalunya, but no problems with street noise, the room was fine. A little small, but we didnt spend much time there anyway. We didnt eat in the restaurant and breakfast wasnt included so cant comment! Would go back.

Great Position and Value for Money We stayed at the Plaza Mayor in November 2006 during our Around the World trip. The staff were absolutely fabulous and so helpful. They recommended places to eat, especially La Bola,and advised us how to get around Madrid. The room we stayed in was fabulous and had everything we needed. We would certainly return to this Gem of a Hotel.

Four star location, one star service The palomar is an elegant hotel with a good central downtown location. The restaurant is rated highly by a number of gourment magazines and rooms are pleasant if on the small side. However the front desk staff have no interest in helping customers outside of routine check in and check out. Service is more akin to a 1 star hotel. I would rate the hotel 4 stars for location and 1 star for servic

Great stay at the Palomar Stayed here for five nights, excellent food and service. A meal in the resaurant is a must and the breakfasts are good, but expensive. Lovely quiet room at the back, no view to speak of but didn't need it as the hotels central location means that more time is spent outside the room than inside! Could not fault this hotel, a perfect place to start a holiday in California.

we are going back We have just returned from the most wonderful week at this resort. There is nothing we can say that is negitive about it the food was wonderful, the rooms were spotless, the employes went out of there way to help and to look after your every needs, and always with a smile on there faces. We are going back for 2 weeks.......

understanted Elegance! PERFECT!!! Had an amazing stay at what I consider to be an outstanding hotel. The room was clean, fresh and all the stops were pulled out to make our stay a memorable one. AMAZING!Darren + Ivka

Excellent hotel Was very pleased with the Orchard Garden Hotel. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Excellent location in the city. Did not eat in the restaurant, but did enjoy a glass of wine and some cheese in the comfortable bar area. Nice breakfast with a good selection of items. Would definitely stay here again.

10 times better than the reviews to date Made reservations for the Civic Center Ramada through Yahoo travel/Travelocity. Stumbled across the reviews here and became nervous. Experieces was great. Old hotel but helpful staff, nice room. Well worth the money paid.

Decent, comfortable rooms Provides decent accomodation. If you are looking for a luxurious hotel with helpful staff, this most certainly is not the place. However, the rooms are clean and the parking is free. For a Boston hotel, the price is economical. The neighborhood is in transition, but I still would not wander around after dark.

Seattle's Best! Arrived very late in the evening for a one night stay. Staff were very solicitous, and on par with the hotel's service standards, each request was met with of course. All staff were pleasant, rooms were comfortably furnished with the latest innovations in guest room design, baths were wonderful. Even for a one night stay, this property was the best I've experienced in Seattle. Special kudos to the Pan Pacific for staff training; this is the best formal service I've received in a long time!

Problems with Website I have not stayed at the hotel, but did make an online reservation through the hotel's official website. This has proven impossible to cancel online. The hotels cancellation web-page is non-responsive and my hotel-issued booking number is too many digits to fit in the dialog box. I was especially concerned about this when I noted the other reviewer's comments on this site which indicates that he was charged even when he e-mailed his cancellation. Obviously this hotel has problems.

Great value, huge rooms This property isn't the nicest or the best location, but the rooms are huge and clean. I stay here for business a lot and can really spread out, like having an apartment while I'm away from home. The staff isn't the best, but friendly and accomodating. If you are going to the convention center, this is one block away. If you're leisure traveling, there are other great places to stay in the same rate level with more character, but for extended trips it can't be beat for the price and comfort.

Nice little hotel in the middle of the big apple It a small hotel on the Manhattan side of the brooklyn bridge that is good for a business or pleasure traveler. Standard Hampton morning breakfast, helpful staff, but very small rooms, so if you are trying to fit more than 2 people in the room, it might be cramped. Walking distance to most lower manhattan toruist sites, and the deli around the corner is very good. Nothing fancy, just gets the job done.

a true oasis I stayed at this hotel about 2 years ago and previously wrote a review based on that stay, saying i thought the value vs. price was not worth it, that it was overpriced for the caliber of hotel it was purporting to be, but I TOTALLY retract my negative comments. i just stayed there again on my last visit to London and couldn't have stayed at a finer hotel. the price is very comparable to other luxury hotels in London and what you actually get in return is tremendous, beginning from the warm welcome by the friendly and extremely knowledgeable staff, to the welcome glass of champagne and array of snacks, to the invitation to join them for canap茅s and drinks in the evening and the turndown service with candles, robes and slippers laid out. it's a true oasis from the rush of central London. you won't regret it!

The Silla is fabulous and so reasonable Brilliant, quiet, family run, view over Arno, 5 mins walk from ponte vecchio - ask for room 23 or equivalent - aircond is whisper quiet but enough to mask traffic and partner's snoring. Recent refurbish is good though ensuite is small - who cares the shower works well. Lovely terrace for breakfast or drinks - minibar in room will take your duty free, but no tea making equipment (only minus point). Can't wait to get back.

Treat in Amsterdam I stayed at the Piet Hein with my boyfriend for 2 nights in March based on the user reviews posted on Trip Advisor and wasn't disappointed. This area of Amsterdam is great as it's out of the main hustle and bustle, near the museums and close enough to be able to hop on a tram and be in the heart of the action. The staff were friendly, polite and helpful and the place was clean as were the rooms - nice white linen and a bright, clean, modern bathroom. The hotel is also located right next to Vondel Park, great for strolling around and watching the locals run, jog and walk their dogs (sometimes at the same time!).I would definately go back here when next visiting Amsterdam.

Wonderful exterior but damp The Fullerton is in a fantastic location - especially if you are doing business in Singapore. And it looks great from the outside. But the rooms can be very damp and musty - and I've stayed in this hotel on about 8 separate occasions now.... Plus worst of all is that sometimes in the middle of the night I've been woken up by extremely loud airconditioning noises. Not acceptable in a 5 star hotelIf in Singapore and looking for a decent hotel I'd recommend 4 Seasons or Raffles The Plaza as better hotels for similar or lower price.

>A perfect beginning A fantastic location providing excellent value for money. For 拢50 a night in central san francisco this hotel is certainly a find. The continental breakfast is a good start to the day including waffles, breakfast croisants, cereal, toast and huge muffins. The hotel is two minutes from union square and close to both Powell Mason Hyde and California cable car lines. My only criticism is that the rooms are a little small and you can find yourself falling over your bags.

Great hotel! I really enjoyed my stay at the Barcelo Hotel Sants. I spent a week there and if you're looking for moderatly priced accommodation in an excellent location, i would thoroughly recommend you stay here. Location, service, rooms were all excellent. I have to say that i did find the breakfast fairly expensive (approx 11 euro), although you do get a discount rate if staying in the hotel. Definately very good value and well worth the stay!!!

Great location! Great location base from which to explore Amsterdam. Basic amenities, but that was all we needed for a City break. Rooms were clean and serviced, breakfast was provided and there was plenty to fill up on. For the price we paid it was a great value for money and the reception staff were very helpful in answering questions, booking taxis etc. The only grumble was that there was a lot of noise in the night due to other guests coming back late!

Quality hotel at reasonable prices - recommended I stayed in the hotel on the first weekend in February with friends who were celebrating a wedding. Found the hootel to be spotlessly clean, convenient for the underground and most of the sites, the staff were very friendly and all spoke good English. I only ate there at breakfast, but this was excellent with lots of choice and good serving times. The bar was lively in the evening and the barmen were very helpful in recommending places to visit. The receptionists also helped to locate traditional German food and everyone enjoyed the hospitality of our hosts. It was my first visit to Berlin, but I will definitely be going again and will stay at the Movenpick.

Very bad place We stayed at the hotel in two days from the 12of dec. to the 14of dec. 2008. The hotel are run down, the room are smelly and dirty, and the staff are not very helpfully at all. Eating breakfast at the hotel is expencive and you are still hungry after, because of the very small portions. We where gratefull that we only had to spent two days there, before going to Miami port for a seven days cruise with the beautifull ship Freedom of the Seas. Never again the Marseilles Hotel.

Great times in Botticelli We spent a lovely holiday at your hotel Botticelli from 7th sept. till 18th sept. Our room and the hotel services was absolutely satisfying. We would like to visit you again, as soon as its possible!Many thanks to the whole team!

Great little hotel I have just returned from a weekend in Barcelona and this hotel was great for my stay. The location is amazing, literally 2 minutes walk from La Rambla, a lot of people say this area is dodgy but as long as you don't walk around on your own it's fine and I never felt under threat going out for dinner at night, just try to stick to the busier roads rather than the small alleys. The hotel was extremely basic but clean which is the most important thing. We had a well equipped bathroom, a TV and a mini bar apart from tea making faciliites there was nothing more we needed. The staff are very helpful too. If you're looking for a budget hotel in Barcelona then this is a great option.

Hotel De Gerstekorrel I stayed at the Hotel De Gerstekorrel on February 2006. Decent accomodations. Nothing fancy, nothing too shabby. Rooms were a little small with small beds and a small bathroom. I would stay there again if I was on a budget and trying to save money.

Fairytale trip to the sky. What is not to like. We checked prices at several top rated hotels and this was the best deal for the money. The room was impecible, the service outstanding and the view was wonderful. The trip to the Top of the Mark was the topper with even greater views and a band you could actually dance too. If you have any romance in your soul, do not miss the historic Mark.

Quite happy Very near to the cable car stop, which was really handy, and a great touristy thing to do. The room itself was pretty average - a bit dated, but was adequate for our needs. Our room had a great view of the Golden Gate bridge which was good. Would probably go back.

Good overall The hotel staff was fairly friendly, albeit slow service in the restaurants. On the upside: the room was clean/comfortable and the banquet food quite excellent. I would be willing to return.

Loved the hotel This was a family trip for our daughter's senior year of high school and had always wanted to visit New York. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel than the Sofitel. Room, comfort, service, and anything we may asked for was great. The doormen are always pleasant and greet you going and coming (great source for info). Would recommend this for anybody and hope to stay again.

loved the Marroitt my stay at the marriott was july 1-4, 04 I really liked the location and the staff was great considering that I was there during the Essence music festival and it was full to capacity. my only disappointment was that the room was half cleaned and we had to wait for clean towels. other that that i will be back next year the same time same place.

Wonderful Stay Our stay in early January went well beyond our hopes. From the friendly welcome to the lovely room, the excellent breakfast and the superb location just off the Champs Elysees, it is hard to see how anything could have been better. I would certainly stay there again.

Perfect location for cruise ship passengers! We stayed two nights prior to leaving on a cruise. Location was great, really enjoyed the riverwalk and Harrahs across the street. Lots of conventions held there, check in took over an hour! Rooms were nice enough, what I expected from Hilton. We walked to the French Qtr and walked to the Peir with our rolling luggage!
